Name: Crippling Famishment
Description: The target unit must divide all its movement by half (rounding up) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Grief-stricken
Description: Until the start of the caster's next turn, the target unit suffer -1 To Hit in close combat, and models targeting them in close combat gain +1 To Hit.

Name: Shadowblood
Description: When cast, Neferata must declare how many Wounds she is using to boost the effects of the spell. The spell causes D6 S 5 hits with Flaming Attacks plus an extra D6 hits for each wound Neferata expends. In addition, a unit suffering one or more wounds from this spell must immediately take a Panic test.

Name: Under a Killing Moon
Description: The target unit gains Frenzy. This has no effect on models with Undead except Dire Wolves.

Name: The Deliverance of Itza
Description: Targets all enemy units within range. Each target suffers 2D6 S 4 hits. If a target has Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, it suffers 3D6 hits instead. If this spell is lost, forgotten, swapped or stolen by any means, Lord Kroak will immediately remember it again and, if applicable, the Wizard that swapped or stole it will immediately forget it.

Name: Coils of the Serpent
Description: Targets a single model (even a character in a unit). The target must pass a T test. If failed, the model is removed from play, with no saves allowed.

Name: Fog of Death
Description: Affects all units in range. Each unit suffers D6 S 3 hits.

Name: Summon Daemons
Description: Can target units of Pink Horrors, Screamers or Flamers. The target unit immediately gains D6 Wounds worth of models added to the unit.

Name: Whispers of Doubt
Description: Targets a single model. The target must take a LD test usind 3D6; if failed, all close combat attacks targeting that character gain +1 To Hit until the start of your next Magic phase.

Name: Nightmare
Description: The unit immediately must take a Panic test. This has no effect on models already in close combat.

Name: Curse of the Dark Master
Description: Until the start of Be'lakor's next magic phase, the target unit suffer a -1 To Hit penalty with both shooting and close combat attacks.

Name: Bolt of Dark Light
Description: Causes D6 S 5 hits.

Name: Decay of Ages
Description: Remains in play. The target unit must pass an immediate T test or lose -1 to their M, WS, BS, S, T and I. They must keep testing at the start of each subsequent Magic Phase until they pass the T test, the spell is dispelled or the unit is removed as a casualty. If the spell is dispelled or the unit passes the T test, the unit is restored to their original characteristics.

Name: Ruination of Cities
Description: The target unit suffers 2D6 S 5 hits. A unit that suffers any wounds from this spell will have all its movement halved (rounding up) in its next Movement phase. Units inside a building take 3D6 S 5 hits. Flying models and other units that ignore terrain effects are unaffected by this spell.

Name: Curse of the Horned Rat
Description:
Can affect Infantry units. The unit suffers 3D6 Hits, though no single model can be Hit more than once. Each model Hit is automatically slain with only
Magic Resistance being allowed as saves. If the whole unit is removed as casualties, replace them with a number of Clanrats equal to the number of casualties, with any normally allowed equipment or command, facing the same direction as before. The casting player now controls this unit. If the casting player does not have enough models to replace the entire unit, transfigure what you can, the rest are considered destroyed. If the number rolled is not great enough to replace the whole targeted unit, then remove as many casualties as the number rolled.

Name: Lycancurse
Description: Targets Infantry. The target unit suffer 2D6 Wounds which Ignores Armour Saves. If this results in all the models getting removed as casualties, the number of slain models gets transformed into a unit of Dire Wolves controlled by you, facing the same direction as before.

Name: Wraithstorm
Description: The target unit inflicts D6 close combat attacks on itself. If any models in that unit are slain as a result of this spell, that unit immediately inflicts another D6 close combat attacks on itself. This has no effect on single model units.

Name: Traitor's Mist
Description: Is a spell that Sayl can cast upon himself. Sayl may immediately make a move using Fly (10) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. In addition any model (friend or foe) in base contact at the start of the move suffers an automatic S 3 hit which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Wraith Storm
Description: Place the large template anywhere within range; it will scatter D6". Any model touched by the template takes a S 3 hit.

Name: Sword of Rezhebel
Description: Remains in Play. Is cast on the Wizard itself. The sword gives the wizard +1 To Hit, +2 S, +1 A and Flaming Attacks and Magical Attacks to their close combat attacks.

Name: The Writhing Mists
Description: Remains in play. Any enemy attacks targeted at the unit will suffer a -1 to hit penalty.

Name: Mistress of the Deep
Description: Remains in play. Place an appropriate marker no larger than 1" in diameter to represent the Oceanid within range of the Wizard. Whenever an enemy unit wishes to fire upon or declare a charge against a unit in the High Elf army, it must first measure the distance to the Oceanid. If the Oceanid is closer than the target unit, it must make a LD test. If the test is failed, the enemy unit is distracted by the Oceanid, and the attack/charge is not performed. If the test is passed, no Oceanid will have any effect against that unit for the rest of the game. This spell has no effect against units with Immunity (Psychology).

Name: Fires of U'zhul
Description: Causes D6 S 4 hits with Flaming Attacks.

Name: Pavane of Slaanesh (Bound Spell)
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). If successfully cast, the target must pass a Psychology test on 3D6. If failed, the target suffers 1 Wound which Ignores Armour saves for every point they failed the Psychology test by.

Name: Flight of Zimmeran
Description: Is cast on the wizard itself. They immediately make a move using Fly as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase.

Name: Raise Dead (ZP Bound Spell)
Description:
Brings a brand new unit of Zombie Pirate Deckhands into play. Choose a point on the battlefield â€“ that point need not lie in the caster's line of sight or forward arc. Next, roll 2D6+3. This is how many models comprise the new unit.

When placing this unit, it must be wholly within the spell's range and at least 1" away from all units, buildings and impassable terrain. It can be placed facing any direction, and in any legal formation, as long as the unit's front rank contains at least five models. This unit does not have any upgrades or command models. Units summoned by this spell cannot be dispelled, and do not award victory points under any circumstances. Finally, if a summoned unit cannot be placed because there is not enough room, the unit does not enter play at all, though the spell's lore
attribute may still apply.

Name: Dread of Aramar
Description: The target must immediately take a Panic test.

Name: Silver Arrows of Arha
Description: Causes 2D6/3D6 S 3 hits.

Name: Luck of Shemtek
Description: Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target unit re-rolls all To Hit, To Wound and armour save rolls of 1. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Spell of Disease and Destruction
Description: The target unit suffers D6 S 4 Hits which Ignores Armour Saves. At the end of the next Magic phase, the unit will suffer an additional D6 Hits. Remains in Play.

Name: Corruption
Description: The target unit suffers D6 S 2 Hits with Ignores Armour Saves. This has no effect against Animated Constructs.

Name: Wrath
Description: If cast, it causes D6 S 4 hits. This is a Lightning attack.

Name: Hellish Vigour (Bound Spell)
Description: Targets a friendly Undead unit within range. The unit gains Always Strikes First and may re-rolls failed To Hit rolls in Close Combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Vanhel's Danse Macabre (Bound Spell)
Description: That targets a friendly unengaged Undead unit within range. The target unit can immediately make a normal move (but not march or reform) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase (including any Characters in the unit) Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range.

Name: The Casket of Ages
Description: Targets one enemy model in base contact. The target model suffers one Wound which Ignores Armour Saves. If the Wound is not saved, the victim must pass a T or get removed as a casualty, with no saves of any kind allowed.

Name: Venom Staff
Description: If successfully cast, the target takes 2D6 S 4 hits.

Name: Ravening
Description: Causes 3D6 S 2 hits.

Name: Wrath of the Sands
Description: The target suffer -2 To Hit when shooting and -1 to their charge distance rolls until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Reawakening of Ancient Might
Description: Is cast on the Khemric Titan itself. When successfully cast, it restores one Wound previously suffered during the battle.

Name: Shem's Burning Gaze (Bound Spell)
Description: Causes D6 S 4 hits which count as Flaming Attacks. Against models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, this is increased to 2D6 Hits.

Name: Liber Bubonicus
Description: When cast, roll a D6 on the Liber Bubonicus Table.

Name: Dark Lightning Bolts
Description: Causes an artillery dice worth of S 5 hits with Lightning Attacks. In the case of a misfire, no shots are fired, but instead, roll on the Storm Daemon Misfire Chart.

Name: Bubonic Sceptre
Description: If cast, roll a D6 for every model in the unit. For every roll of a 6, that unit suffers a wound which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Warpscroll
Description: Inflicts a S 3 Hit on all models in the unit. If the unit suffers any casualties from the spell, they must also take a Panic test.

Name: 'Eadbutt (Bound Spell)
Description: One enemy Wizard within range suffers a S 4 hit that inflicts Multiple Wounds (D3), which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Fireball (Bound Spell)
Description: Causes D6 S 4 hits.

Name: Bang
Description: Causes 2D6 S 4 Hits with Flaming Attacks.

Name: Steed of Shadows (Bound Spell)
Description: Can be cast on Infantry character (including the Wizard) within range. The target immediately makes a move using Fly (10) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. In addition, the target will count as being Ethereal for the purpose of resolving missile attacks against it until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Urannon's Thunderbolt (Bound Spell)
Description: Causes D6 S 6 hits with Lightning Attacks.

Name: The Speed of Light (Bound Spell)
Description: The target unit gains Always Strikes First until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Banishment (Bound Spell)
Description: The target suffers 2D6 hits. Against models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, this is increased to 3D6 Hits. The S of the hits is equal to 4 plus the number of Wizards that know spells from the Lore of Light within 12" of the caster (not counting the caster them self). Successful Ward saves taken against Banishment must be re-rolled.

Name: Net of Amyntok (Bound Spell)
Description: The target unit must pass a S test every time it moves in the Movement phase, shoots or casts spells until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If the test is passed, the target acts normally. If the test is failed, the unit is unable to perform the desired action, remaining in place and taking D6 S 4 hits. Against models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, this is increased to 2D6 Hits.

Name: Shield of Myrmidia
Description: The Priest and her unit add +1 to their armour saves, and gain Ward save (5+) against missile attacks. Remains in Play.

Name: Purge
Description: Target one enemy model within range of the Inquisitor that is within his line of sight. Both players roll a D6 and add the LD of their respective models. If the Inquisitor scores higher than the target model, the target's LD is reduced by 3 until the start of the Inquisitor's next Magic phase.

Name: Might of the Goddess
Description: Might of the Goddess doubles the basic S of the user until the start of his next turn, but may not use any Magic Weapons while Might of the Goddess is in effect.

Name: Scourging
Description: Causes D6 S 5 hits.

Name: Holocaust
Description: Place the small round template anywhere in base contact with the Inquisitor. All models, friend or foe, covered by the template suffer a S 4 hit. Against Daemons, Undead and Wizards the S is increased to 5.

Name: The Silver Horn
Description: Targets all fleeing friendly units within range. The target units will automatically Rally.

Name: Power of Darkness (Bound Spell)
Description: All models in the target unit have a +1 bonus to their S until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Then add D3 power dice to your power pool. If a natural 6 is rolled when generating these power dice, the caster suffers a Wound which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Dark Dimension
Description: Targets all enemy models in base contact with the caster. The target models must pass a S test or be removed as casualties with no saves except Magic Resistance allowed.

Name: Gnarlrod of Nurgle
Description: When cast, roll a D6; this is the number of enemy units affected by the spell, chosen by Rotigus. Each affected unit suffers D6 S 3 Hits which Ignores Armour Saves.

Name: Staff of Slaanesh
Description: The target unit takes 2D6 Wounds. Saves are taken as normal.

Name: Rancid Visitations (Bound Spell)
Description: Inflicts D6 S 5 hits. The target unit must then immediately pass a T test or suffer a further D6 S 5 hits. The target must keep testing its T in this manner until a test is passed, or the target is removed as a casualty.

Name: Infernal Fire
Description: Targets all enemy units within range (including units in close combat). The target units suffer D6 S 5 Hits with Flaming Attacks.

Name: The Lady's Virtue of Valour
Description: Roll a D6, the result is the number of characteristics that are increased by 1 until the start of the wizard's next Magic Phase in the following order: WS, I, S, T, A, LD.

Name: Beguilement of Blondel
Description: Remains in play. All enemy units in range must take a LD test. If failed the unit counts as failing a Stupidity test. Failing units in close combat will instead have WS 1. Enemy units must take tests for as long as the spell remains active.

Name: Mist of Chalons
Description: Reamins in play. Affects all units in range of the wizard. Enemy units shooting at affected units suffer -1 to hit them with shooting weapons.

Name: Spite
Description: Every Arcane Item within range immediately explodes in the hands of its bearer (friend and foe). Each bearer of an Arcane Item within range suffers D6 S 4 hits per item. The items are immediately destroyed.

Name: Wind Blast (Bound Spell 4+)
Description: The target is 'pushed' 2D3" directly away from the caster (it does not change facing). If the target unit comes into contact with impassable terrain it stops 1" away and suffers D6 S 3 hits. If the target unit comes into contact with another unit it stops 1" away and both units suffer D6 S 3 hits. Targets that cannot move are not pushed back at all, but still suffer D6 S 3 hits.

Name: Iceshard Blizzard (Bound Spell)
Description: The target suffers a -1 to their WS, BS and LD until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Shooting attacks that do not use BS must roll 4+ on a D6 before firing, or the shot(s) is lost. This is an Ice Attack.

Name: Sand Storm (Bound Spell)
Description: Remains in Play. Affects all units (friend and foe) within range. No units within the sand storm can use missile weapons, and war machines cannot fire. No units may be targeted by any missile attack. Flying units are restricted to their ground movement. Enemy units affected cannot march in their next movement phase.

Name: Retribution
Description: Causes D6 S 5 hits.

Name: Wind Blast (Bound Spell 3+)
Description: The target is 'pushed' 2D3" directly away from the caster (it does not change facing). If the target unit comes into contact with impassable terrain it stops 1" away and suffers D6 S 3 hits. If the target unit comes into contact with another unit it stops 1" away and both units suffer D6 S 3 hits. Targets that cannot move are not pushed back at all, but still suffer D6 S 3 hits.

Name: Orb of Thunder
Description: Remains in play. The Orb of Thunder effects all Flying models. When cast, no models may use Fly and must move on the ground at their normal M.

Name: Combra Venom
Description: Causes 2D6 hits. These hits always Wound on a 4+ with Armour Piercing (2).

Name: Flaming Sword of Rhuin (Bound Spell)
Description: The target unit (except mounts) has a +1 bonus when rolling To Wound with all shooting and close combat attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. The target unit also counts as having both Magical Attacks and Flaming Attacks.

Name: Flesh to Stone (Bound Spell)
Description: The target unit has +2 to its T value until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Bestial Surge (Bound Spell)
Description: Affects all nonfleeing friendly units within range. If cast, all units will immediately make a move straight forward following the rules for Random Movement (D6+1).

Name: Viletide (Bound Spell)
Description: Inflicts 5D6 S 1 hits.

Name: Doom of Dol
Description: Remains in play. Targets one enemy model. Choose a friendly character to slay the targetted model. While the spell is active the chosen model wounds the target on 2+ and Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Wrath of Righteousness
Description: All enemy units in range take D6 S 4 hits with Armour Piercing (1).

Name: Spiteful Glance
Description: Targets an enemy character. The character must pass an I test or is slain.

Name: Gong of Tsao Tsao
Description: When cast, all enemy war machines, chariots, shrines and units in buildings within range take D6 S 6 hits. All other unit types have to take a Panic test.

Name: Banner of Change
Description: Inflicts 3D6 S 3 hits on one enemy unit in base contact.

Name: Acquiescence (Bound Spell)
Description: The target unit is subject to Always Strikes Last and Random Movement (D6) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Doombolt of Kharaidon (Bound Spell)
Description: Causes D6 S 5 hits.

Name: The Burning Head (Bound Spell 5+)
Description: Extend a straight line, within the caster's front arc and directly away from their base. Each model in the way (determined as for a bouncing cannonball) suffers a S 4 hit. A unit that suffers one or more casualties from the Burning Head must take a Panic test.

Name: Sanctuary
Description: Remains in Play. While active, Daemons and Undead cannot move within 3" of the Inquisitor or his unit.

Name: Divine Pronouncement
Description: Target one enemy unit within range which is not in close combat in the Shooting phase. This unit must immediately take a Panic test. If the Inquisitor's LD is greater than that of the enemy unit, the test is modified by the difference.

Name: Sword of the Witches
Description: All enemy wizards within range must pass a LD test or take D6 S 4 hits.

Name: Command the Legion
Description: The Priestess gains the Inspiring Presence special rule. Remains in Play.

Name: Spear of Myrmidia
Description: The Priestess and her unit gain +1 S, Armour Piercing (1) and Magical Attacks. Remains in Play.

Name: Pha's Protection (Bound Spell)
Description: All attacks against the target unit (shooting or close combat) suffer a -1 penalty To Hit until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Shooting attacks that do not use BS must roll 4+ on a D6 before firing, or the shot(s) is lost.

Name: Light of Battle (Bound Spell)
Description: If fleeing, the target rallies immediately. Additionally, the target will pass all LD tests (regardless of modifiers) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Birona's Timewarp (Bound Spell)
Description: The target's M is doubled, its I is raised to 10, and its A is increased by 1 until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Blazing Aura of Flames
Description: When cast, all enemy models in base contact suffer a S 5 Hit with Flaming Attacks and Multiple Wounds (D3).

Name: Blood Statuette
Description: Targets one enemy model, even in a unit. The target model must pass a T test or suffer a Wound which Ignores Armour Saves. If the model takes a Wound from this spell, it must immediately take another T test, losing another Wound if it fails again. This continues until either the model passes a T test or is slain.

Name: Plaque of Dominion
Description: Targets all enemy Wizards in range. The targets of this spell have Stupidity until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Wurrzag's Revenge
Description: Affects all enemy Wizards in range of Wurrzag. Roll a D6 for each Wizard that is affected. On a roll of 1-5 they shake off the spell, but on a roll of 6 they are turned into a Squiggly Beast and removed as a casualty, along with any mount they have, with no saves of any kind allowed. In addition, you may store one extra dice in Wizzbang the Power Squig for each Wizard that is transformed.

Name: Skarsnik's Prodder
Description: Causes D3 S 6 hits which Ignores Armour saves. The number of hits is increased to D6 if Skarsnik is within a Night Goblin unit with at least 5 models, not including Skarsnik.

Name: Bands of Power
Description: Can be cast on Snikch himself. If successfully cast, Snikch will double his S until the start of his next Magic phase.

Name: Warp Lightning (Bound Spell)
Description: Causes D6 S 5 hits with Lightning Attacks. If the number of hits rolled is a natural 1, then the caster suffers a S 5 hit instead of the target.

Name: Spirit Leech (Bound Spell)
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). Both caster and target roll a D6 and add their respective unmodified LD values. For every point the caster wins by, the target suffers a Wound which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: The Gaze of Dust
Description: Causes a S 6 Hit which penetrates ranks in the same way as a Bolt Thrower.

Name: Enkhil's Kanopi
Description: If cast successfully, roll a D6 for every 'remains in play' spell on the tabletop: on a 2+ that spell is automatically dispelled. For each spell that is ended in this way, add D3 power dice to your power pool.

Name: The Undying Legion
Description: Can only be cast on the bearer's unit. If successfully cast, the bearer's unit immediately recovers D6+2 Wounds' worth of models, as described in Resurrecting Fallen Warriors.

Name: Flaming Death
Description: Inflicts D6 S 4 hits with Flaming Attacks. In addition, if the target unit moves in the Movement phase, flees or pursues during its next turn, every model in the unit suffers an immediate S 4 hit with Flaming Attacks, after which the spell's effects end. If the unit does not move the spell ends at the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Any unit taking one or more unsaved Wounds from this spell must immediately take a Panic test.

Name: Damnation
Description: All friendly Undead units (and their mounts) within range of the bearer gain +1 A until the start of the bearer's next Magic phase.

Name: Gaze of Nagash (Bound Spell)
Description: Causes 2D6 S 4 hits.

Name: Scrying Pool
Description: If cast successfully, the Coven Throne and all of its constituent parts, including its crew and any character using it as a mount, re-rolls failed To Hit or To Wound rolls (owning player's choice) for the remainder of the turn.

Name: Call Winds
Description: Affects all enemy units within range of the Vampire. Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, all missile attacks fired from within or at a target within this distance suffer -1 To Hit.

Name: Torment
Description: Causes 2D6 S 3 hits.

Name: Gravedust
Description: Remains in Play. While active, the target suffers -1 to its M, S, T and I. At the start of each following Arabyan Magic phase, these characteristics are further deducted by 1, and will continue to do until the spell is either dispelled or their S or T reaches 0.

Name: Abeyance
Description: Remains in Play. While active, you may choose to make the target forgo one of the following actions: move, cast spells, shoot or fight in close combat.

Name: Recede
Description: Remains in Play. While active, the unit may either choose to fire twice in the Shooting phase or attack twice in the Close Combat phase.

Name: A Befuddlement of Mischiefs
Description: The targeted unit counts as having failed a Stupdity test in their next turn.

Name: Blood Bind
Description: May be cast on unengaged units. The target must immediately move forwards using Random Movement (2D6). This has no effect on models with Immunity (Psychology), though Frenzied units are still affected.

Name: Favour of Slaanesh
Description: Until the start of your next magic phase, the target gains Immunity (Psychology) (units with Mark of Slaanesh becomes Unbreakable) and re-rolls failed charge and pursuit distances.

Name: Favour of Nurgle
Description: Until the start of your next magic phase, the target unit can re-roll all failed To Wound rolls.

Name: Favour of Chaos
Description: Until the start of your next magic phase, the target unit can re-roll To Hit and To Wound rolls of 1.

Name: Ice Spikes
Description: Place the small round template anywhere within range of the caster. The area covered by the small template becomes dangerous terrain until the start of the casterâ€™s next magic phase. This does not affect Yhetees and Thundertusks.

Name: Prayer of Potency
Description: One friendly character within range of the Yamabushi may re-roll all failed rolls To Hit and To Wound in close combat. Remains in play.

Name: Blessing of Strength
Description: The unit may re-roll all failed rolls To Wound in close combat.

Name: Burning Alignment
Description: Targets every enemy unit within 4D6". Each target suffers D6 S 4 hits with Flaming Attacks, distributed as for shooting.

Name: Guardian of the Sacred Places
Description: If cast, the Lizardmen player may reposition D3 pieces of forest terrain by D6", rolling the distance for each piece at a time.

Name: Winter's Sleep
Description: All enemy units in base contact with the Priest suffer -1 to their WS and I, and an additional -1 for each turn that this spell lasts (Minimum of 1). Remains in Play.

Name: Unyielding Ursun
Description: The Priest and his unit is Stubborn until the start of the next friendly magic phase.

Name: Solheim's Bolt of Illumination
Description: The spell causes a S 8 hit that has Multiple Wounds (D3) and Flaming Attacks, and penetrates ranks in the same manner as a shot from a bolt thrower. Armour saves are not permitted against Wounds caused by Solheim's Bolt of Illumination. If the target is Undead, Nehekharan Undead, or Daemonic, all failed To Wound rolls caused by this spell are re-rolled.

Name: Restore Essence
Description: The Disciple and his unit gain Regeneration (5+) until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Fist of Khaine
Description: The Disciple and his unit may re-roll all failed rolls To Hit and To Wound in close combat until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Winter's Chill
Description: Any units engaged in close combat with the Priest or the unit he is with suffer a -1 to hit penalty in the next Close Combat phase.

Name: Battle Howl
Description: As long as the Battle Howl is in effect, the Priest and any unit he leads add D6" to their charge moves. If the charge is failed, the extra movement is wasted; make a normal move towards the target as normal. Remains in Play.

Name: Shadows of Hashut
Description: Draw a line from the base of the Altar. Every model crossed by the line suffers a S 4 hit.

Name: Fists of Fire
Description: Until the start of your next Magic phase, the target unit may re-roll failed rolls To Wound and gains Magical Attacks and Flaming Attacks in close combat.

Name: Renewed Valour
Description: Affects all friendly units with Blessing of the Lady within range. All fleeing friendly Knights within range will rally automatically and regain the Blessing of the Lady (if they have lost it).

Name: Purify
Description: All Hex spells effecting friendly units within 12" are automatically dispelled. In addition, any Undead or Daemonic units in base contact with the Priestess takes D6 S 5 hits.

Name: Shallya's Endurance
Description: When cast, the unit the Priestess is with (but not herself) gets +1 to its T until the start of her next Magic Phase.

Name: Soulfire
Description: The Warrior Priest and his unit gain Magical and Flaming Attacks until the start of the next friendly Magic phase. In addition, when cast, all enemy models in base contact with the Warrior Priest suffer a S 4 hit. Models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric in base contact suffer a S 5 hit instead, which Ignores Armour Saves.

Name: Shield of Faith
Description: The Warrior Priest and his unit gain a Ward save (5+) against all Wounds inflicted in close combat until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Hammer of Sigmar
Description: The Warrior Priest and his unit reroll all failed To Wound rolls in close combat until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Compassionate Mind
Description: When cast, the unit she is within gains Immunity (Psychology) and Stubborn until the start of her next Magic Phase.

Name: Radiant Light
Description: Affects all enemy units within range. Until the start of your next turn, the targets suffer -1 to their WS and BS.

Name: Flaming Hide
Description: Until the start of your next Magic phase, the target unit gains a Ward Save (6+), and any enemy model in base contact with this unit suffers a S 3 Hit with Flaming Attacks at the start of the close combat phase.

Name: Prayers of Malice
Description: The target unit gains a 6+ Ward save until the start of your next Magic phase.

Name: Destruction
Description: Every enemy unit in base contact with the Priest suffers D6+2 S 4 hits.

Name: Fury of Khaine
Description: The target gains Frenzy until the start of the Cauldron of Blood's next Magic phase. If the target already has Frenzy, that Frenzy grants +2 A to every model in the unit instead of just +1 until the start of the Cauldron of Blood's next Magic phase. Fury of Khaine is not cumulative with Witchbrew.

Name: Rend Soul
Description: One enemy unit in base contact with the Disciple suffer D6 S 3 hits and suffer -1 to their S until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Storm of Shemtek
Description: Place the small round template over the target and scatter it D6". The result of the D6 is also used to determine the type of storm that is summoned (see Storm chart). If a Hit! is rolled, the template does not scatter. If the template hits a Flying unit, it suffers D6 S 4 hits, in addition to any other effects (even if a Sudden Downpour is summoned).

Name: Unbending Righteousness
Description: Luthor Huss and his unit gain Stubborn until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Ursine Strength
Description: The Priest and his unit may re-roll failed rolls To Wound in close combat until the start of the next friendly magic phase.

Name: Beam of Chotec
Description: If successfully cast, roll a D6 and consult the Beam of Chotec table to determine the S and number of hits (as well as any other effects) caused by this spell. All hits caused by Beam of Chotec are Flaming Attacks.

Name: Blessing of Persistence
Description: Enemies attacking the unit suffer -1 To Wound.

Name: Blessing of Swiftness
Description: The unit may re-roll the distance moved when charging and pursuing.

Name: Prayer of Invigoration
Description: One friendly character within range of the Yamabushi will regain all Wounds previously lost during the battle.

Name: Prayer of Protection
Description: One friendly character within range of the Yamabushi will gain a Ward save (4+) until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase.

Name: Hunger of the Great Maw
Description: Until the casterâ€™s next magic phase, the target unit may re-roll failed rolls To Hit. If the unit does not win a round of combat until then, each model in the unit must pass a T test or suffer 1 Wound with no saves allowed.

Name: Ice Spear
Description: Causes a single S 5 hit with Ice Attacks and Multiple Wound (D3). No Regeneration saves are allowed against any wounds suffered from the Ice Spear.

Name: Snowstorm
Description: Is cast upon the caster himself and affects all units within 6". Any shooting targeted at units within the Snowstorm suffer -1 To Hit to their shooting attacks.

Name: Light of Death
Description:
The target of Light of Death must take a LD test on 3D6, adding the results together. If the test is passed, nothing happens. Otherwise, for each point the unit failed the test by, it suffers an automatic Wound which Ignores Armour saves, distributed as for shooting attacks.

Once the LD test has been resolved, roll a D6: on a 3 or more, choose another unengaged enemy unit within 6" of the initial target, the unit must also suffer the effects of the Light of Death spell. Keep rolling for further victims (each within 6" of the last target struck), until the roll is failed or there are no more viable targets. A unit can only be the target of Light of Death once per Magic phase.

Name: Favour of Khorne
Description: Until the start of your next magic phase, the target unit can re-roll all failed To Hit rolls.

Name: Favour of Tzeentch
Description: Until the start of your next magic phase, the target unit gains Ward save (6+), and may re-roll 1's when taking Ward saves.

Name: Aura of Mutation
Description: Roll a D6, and consult the Aura of Mutation table to discover how many T tests the target must take, and if any long-lasting mutations have occurred. For each T test failed, the target suffers a single Wound which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Blood Boil
Description: The target unit suffers D6 S 5 Hits which Ignore Armour saves. This has no effect against Ethereal models, Animated Constructs or Forest Spirits

Name: A Lamentation of Despairs
Description: Can be used to target enemy characters or monsters. The targeted model must pass a LD test, or else suffer D3 Wounds which Ignore Armour saves.

Name: Rune of Stone and Steel
Description: Targets a single friendly Dwarf unit anywhere on the battlefield. The target unit increases their armour save by 1 (to a maximum of 1+) until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Rune of Oath and Honour
Description: Targets a single friendly Dwarf Infantry unit anywhere on the battlefield. The target unit may immediately make an additional move as if were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. Note that no unit may be moved more than once per turn by this spell.

Name: Rune of Hearth and Hold
Description: Targets a single friendly Dwarf unit anywhere on the battlefield. The target unit gains Stubborn until the start of the next friendly Magic phase. If the unit is already Stubborn, it becomes Unbreakable instead.

Name: Rune of Wrath and Ruin
Description: Causes 2D6 S 4 hits, distributed as per shooting.

Name: Rune of Doom
Description: Targets every friendly Dwarf unit within range. The target units gain Fear until the start of the next friendly Magic phase.

Name: Kindleflame
Description: All of the spells in the Lore of Fire are Flaming Attacks. In addition if a direct damage or magic missile spell from the Lore of Fire is cast at a unit that has already been hit by a direct damage or magic missile spell from the Lore of Fire in the same Magic phase (even if the spell was cast by a different Wizard) the spell inflicts an additional D6 Hits.

Name: Gaze of Mork (Bound Spell)
Description: Extend a straight line, within the Shaman's forward arc and directly away from his base. Any model whose base falls under the line suffers a S 4 hit.

Name: Illusory Assault
Description: The target unit must pass a LD test; if failed each model in the unit must fight a round of combat against itself. Any casualties inflicted counts as having been made with shooting attacks and may cause Panic.

Name: Fireball
Description: Causes D6/2D6/3D6 S 4 hits.

Name: Fate Manipulation
Description: When a spell from the Lore of Heavens is successfully cast, roll a D6; on a 4+, the Wizard can re-roll one dice to either change the casting result or the number of Hits inflicted by a spell when casting further spells for the remainder of this Magic phase.

Name: Iceshard Blizzard
Description: The target suffers a -1 to their WS, BS and LD until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Shooting attacks that do not use BS must roll 4+ on a D6 before firing, or the shot(s) is lost. This is an Ice Attack.

Name: Lifebloom
Description: When a spell from the Lore of Life is successfully cast, the Wizard (or another friendly model within range) instantly recovers a single Wound lost earlier in the battle.

Name: Earth Blood
Description:
Is cast on the Wizard itself and any unit they are with. The target unit gains Regeneration (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Alternatively, the Wizard
can choose to target one unit within 12". If they do so, the target gains Regeneration (6+) instead of Regeneration (5+).

Id: awakening of the wood/lore of life
Name: Awakening of the Wood
Description: Causes D6 S 4 hits. If the target is within 3" a forest, the number of hits is increased to 2D6.

Name: Flesh to Stone
Description: The target unit has +2 to its T value until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Throne of Vines
Description:
Remains in play. Is cast upon the Wizard. Whilst the spell is in effect, every time the Wizard miscasts, roll a dice. On a 4+, the miscast is ignored. 

Furthermore, the Wizard's castings of the following spells have additional benefits (it does not change the effects of spells that have already been cast):

â€¢ Earth Blood grants +1 to the target's Regeneration save.
â€¢ Awakening of the Wood instead inflicts hits at S 5.
â€¢ Flesh to Stone instead adds +3 T.
â€¢ Regrowth instead restores D6+1 wounds worth of models.
â€¢ Shield of Thorns instead hits at S 4.

Name: Shield of Thorns
Description: Remains in play. At the end of each Magic phase, any enemy unit in base contact with the target suffers 2D6 S 3 hits.

Name: Regrowth
Description: The target unit instantly recovers D3+1 Wounds' worth of models slain earlier in the battle (Cavalry count as 2 models). The wounds in the unit are regained in a strict order. First the musician and then the standard bearer is resurrected, displacing rank-and-file models as required. Then rank-and-file models with multiple Wounds are healed to their starting value. Finally, any remaining wounds resurrect rank and file models (in the case of multiple wound rank and file models, the first resurrected models must be fully healed before another can be resurrected, and so on). These are added to the front or rear of the unit as you wish as long as the unit keeps a legal formation. If the unit already has more than one rank, models can only be added to the rear rank. Regrowth cannot take a unit beyond its starting size, and cannot be used to heal characters or their mounts.

Name: The Dwellers Below
Description: Every model in the target unit must pass a S test or be slain, with no saves except Magic Resistance allowed.

Name: Wildheart
Description: If a spell from the Lore of Beasts is targeted on one or more units of war beasts, cavalry, monstrous beasts, monstrous cavalry, chariots, monsters, swarms or any unit from Warhammer: Beastmen, then the casting difficulty of the spell is reduced by 1.

Name: Wyssan's Wildform
Description: The target unit gains +1 S and +1 T until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: the flock of doom/lore of beasts
Name: The Flock of Doom
Description: Causes 3D6 S 2 hits.

Name: Pann's Impenetrable Pelt
Description: Is cast upon the Wizard or another friendly character within range. The target gains +3 T until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: The Amber Spear
Description: Inflicts a single S 6/10 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3/D6) and Ignores Armour saves that penetrates ranks in the same manner as a shot from a bolt thrower if the first model is slain - the S of the hit is reduced by 1 for each subsequent rank.

Id: the curse of anraheir/lore of beasts
Name: The Curse of Anraheir
Description: The target unit suffers a -1 penalty to its To Hit rolls (to both its shooting and close combat attacks) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. In addition, the unit treats all terrain (other than open and impassable terrain) as dangerous terrain and will fail Dangerous Terrain tests on a 1 or 2, rather than a 1.

Id: the savage beast of horros/lore of beasts
Name: The Savage Beast of Horros
Description: Is cast on a friendly character, which can be the Wizard. The character (but not any mount) gains +3 S and +3 A until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Transformation of Kadon
Description:
Can only be cast upon the Wizard, and only if they are on foot. Whilst the spell is in effect, the Wizard transmogrifies itself into a Monster. 

If the Wizard is in a unit, they can remain within the unit, even though they are now technically a monster. If they cannot be placed because there is not enough room, the spell does not work. Whilst transformed, the Wizard cannot channel or cast spells, and all of their magic items and mundane equipment (armour, weapons, etc.) temporarily stop working. Any wounds suffered by the Wizard are not carried over between transformations.

Name: Life Leeching
Description: When a Lore of Death spell is resolved, roll a D6 for each unsaved wound caused by the spell (models removed by the Purple Sun of Xereus each add a number of dice equal to their Wounds characteristic). For each 6 rolled on these additional dice, the Wizard immediately adds a dice to their army's power pool.

Name: Spirit Leech
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). Both caster and target roll a D6 and add their respective LD values. For every point the caster wins by, the target suffers a Wound which Ignores Armour saves.

Id: aspect of the dreadknight/lore of death
Name: Aspect of the Dreadknight
Description: The target unit gains Fear until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If they already cause Fear, they now cause Terror.

Id: the caress of laniph/lore of death
Name: The Caress of Laniph
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). If successfully cast, the target suffers a number of hits equal to 2D6 minus their own S. Hits from the Caress of Laniph cause a Wound on a roll of 4+ which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Soulblight
Description: The target has -1 S and -1 T (to a minimum of 1) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Doom and Darkness
Description: Remains in Play. The target suffers a -3 penalty to its LD.

Id: the fate of bjuna/lore of death
Name: The Fate of Bjuna
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). The target suffers a number of hits equal to 2D6 minus their own T. Hits from the Fate of Bjuna cause a wound on a roll of 2+ which Ignores Armour saves. If the target survives, they are subject to Stupidity for the remainder of the game.

Id: the purple sun of xereus/lore of death
Name: The Purple Sun of Xereus
Description: Remains in play. Uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates the direction in which the Purple Sun will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply the result by 3. Any model touched by the template must pass an I test or be slain outright with no saves except Magic Resistance allowed. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster and roll a scatter dice and a D6. The template moves the number of inches equal to the result of the D6, in the direction shown on the scatter dice (if you roll a Hit!, use the little arrow shown on the Hit! symbol). In either event, in subsequent turns, the Purple Sun travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll on an artillery dice. If a misfire is rolled in subsequent turns, the Purple Sun collapses in upon itself and is removed.

Name: Smoke and Mirrors
Description: After a spell from the Lore of Shadow is successfully cast and resolved, the casting Wizard can choose to immediately make a move (but not march) using Fly (10) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase, even if they are in close combat.

Name: Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma
Description: The target unit's WS, BS, I or M (you choose which) is reduced by D3 (to a minimum of 1) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version reduces all four characteristics (don't roll a D3 for each â€“ make one roll and apply it to all four characteristics).

Name: Steed of Shadows
Description: Can be cast on Infantry character (including the Wizard) within range. The target immediately makes a move using Fly (10) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. In addition, the target will count as being Ethereal for the purpose of resolving missile attacks against it until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: The Enfeebling Foe
Description: Remains in play. All models in the target unit have their S reduced by D3 (to a minimum of 1) for the duration of the spell.

Name: The Withering
Description: Remains in play. All models in the target unit have their T reduced by D3 (to a minimum of 1) for the duration of the spell.

Name: The Penumbral Pendulum
Description: Extend a straight line, directly away from the caster. Each model in the way (determined as for a bouncing cannonball) must pass an I test or suffer a S 10 hit causing Multiple Wounds (D3).

Name: Pit of Shades
Description: Place the small/large round template anywhere within range â€“ it then scatters D6"/2D6". All models underneath the template must pass an I test or are removed as casualties with no saves except Magic Resistance allowed.

Name: Okkam's Mindrazor
Description: Lasts until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Models in the target unit (except mounts) use their LD instead of S when rolling To Wound with all close combat attacks whilst the spell remains in effect (any S bonuses from weapons are ignored). Armour saves are taken and modified by the Attack's actual S value.

Id: mists of albion/lore of the truthsayers 1
Name: Mists of Albion
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of the Truthsayers is cast on a friendly unit, enemy units targeting that unit suffer -1 To Hit with missile weapons until the start of the caster's next turn.

Id: blessing of valour/lore of the truthsayers 1
Name: Blessing of Valour
Description: The target unit gets +1 To Hit with shooting and close combat attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Elemental Power
Description: Targets Fenbeasts, Fenhulks and Viridian Lords. The target unit immediately regains D3 Wounds worth of models lost earlier during the battle up to their starting value, or it may choose to make a normal additional move as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase.

Id: wings of fate/lore of the truthsayers
Name: Wings of Fate
Description: Causes 3D6/4D6 S 2 hits.

Id: gift of life/lore of the truthsayers
Name: Gift of Life
Description: Each unit within range instantly recovers 1/D3 Wound worth of models slain earlier in the battle, following the rules of the Regrowth spell from the Lore of Life.

Id: shield of light/lore of the truthsayers
Name: Shield of Light
Description: Remains in play. The unit receives Ward save (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: boon of courage/lore of the truthsayers
Name: Boon of Courage
Description: The target unit is Unbreakable until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If cast on a fleeing unit, the unit immediately rallies, regardless of how many models are left in it. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: voice of command/lore of the truthsayers
Name: Voice of Command
Description: The unit cannot voluntarily move in its next Movement phase or shoot in its next Shooting phase.

Name: Focus of Will
Description: When a Wizard attempts to cast a spell from the Lore of Light, they may choose to take a LD test using their own LD value. If passed, they add +1 to the casting result. If failed, they instead suffer -1 to the casting result.

Name: Shem's Burning Gaze
Description: Causes D6 S 4/6 hits which count as Flaming Attacks. Against models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, this is increased to 2D6 Hits.

Name: Pha's Protection
Description: All attacks against the target unit (shooting or close combat) suffer a -1 penalty To Hit until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Shooting attacks that do not use BS must roll 4+ on a D6 before firing, or the shot(s) is lost. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: the speed of light/lore of light
Name: The Speed of Light
Description: The target unit gains Always Strikes First until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version, affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Light of Battle
Description: If fleeing, the target rallies immediately. Additionally, the target will pass all LD tests (regardless of modifiers) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Net of Amyntok
Description: The target unit must pass a S test every time it moves in the Movement phase, shoots or casts spells until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If the test is passed, the target acts normally. If the test is failed, the unit is unable to perform the desired action, remaining in place and taking D6 S 4 hits. Against models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, this is increased to 2D6 Hits.

Name: Banishment
Description: The target suffers 2D6 hits. Against models with Daemonic, Undead or Vampiric, this is increased to 3D6 Hits. The S of the hits is equal to 4 plus the number of Wizards that know spells from the Lore of Light within 12" of the caster (not counting the caster them self). Successful Ward saves taken against Banishment must be re-rolled.

Name: Birona's Timewarp
Description: The target's M is doubled, its I is raised to 10, and its A is increased by 1 until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Harmonic Convergence
Description: Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target re-rolls all To Hit, To Wound and armour save rolls of 1. Boosted version targets all friendly units within range.

Name: Wind Blast
Description: The target is 'pushed' 2D3"/2D6" directly away from the caster (it does not change facing). If the target unit comes into contact with impassable terrain it stops 1" away and suffers D6 S 3 hits. If the target unit comes into contact with another unit it stops 1" away and both units suffer D6 S 3 hits. Targets that cannot move are not pushed back at all, but still suffer D6 S 3 hits.

Id: curse of the midnight wind/lore of heavens
Name: Curse of the Midnight Wind
Description: The target must re-roll all 6s when rolling to hit, to wound and armour saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version targets all enemy units within range.

Name: Urannon's Thunderbolt
Description: Causes D6 S 6 hits with Lightning Attacks.

Name: Comet of Casandora
Description: This spell is cast upon any fixed point on the table. Place a suitable marker over the exact spot affected. For as long as the spell lasts, the player rolls a D6 at the start of each player's following Magic phase. On a score of 1-3 nothing happens, but place another marker on the first. On the score of a 4-6 the comet strikes the spot. All units from either side that are within 2D6" are struck by the comet. Each unit struck takes 2D6 hits, +1 hit for each marker on the comet, at a S equal to 4 plus the number of markers on the comet. Once cast, the comet cannot be dispelled. Boosted version is cast so that the comet starts with two counters rather than one, and two counters are added each time the comet fails to land.

Name: Chain Lightning
Description: Chain Lightning causes D6 S 6 hits with Lightning Attacks. Once the damage has been resolved, roll a D6; on a 3+, choose an enemy within 6" of the initial target, which suffers D6 S 6 hits. Keep rolling for further victims (each within 6" of the last target struck), until the roll is failed or there are no more viable targets (a unit can only be the target of Chain Lightning once per Magic phase).

Name: Spirit Walk
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of the Serpent is successfully cast on a friendly unit, it gains +D6 to their M and does not need to take any tests for Dangerous Terrain until the start of the caster's next magic phase.

Name: Serpent's Strength
Description: Targets all units within 6" of the Wizard. The unit gains +1 S until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase.

Name: Singing Wind
Description: The Wizard makes a Breath Weapon Attack. This may be cast in close combat, following the normal rules for Breath Weapons. All models Hit suffer a Strength 4/5 Hit.

Name: Wendala's Maelstrom
Description: Targets the Wizard and any unit they are with. Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, all enemy missile attacks targeting them suffer a -1 To Hit penalty. Boosted version targets all friendly units within range.

Id: wall of thorns/lore of the serpent
Name: Wall of Thorns
Description: Is cast on the Wizard and any unit they are with. Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, the Wizard and their unit counts as fighting behind a defended obstacle, and any enemy models in base contact that charges them must take a Dangerous Terrain test. Boosted version covers all friendly units within range.

Id: the living jungle/lore of the serpent
Name: The Living Jungle
Description: Causes 5D6 S 2 hits.

Id: embrace of the serpent/lore of the serpent
Name: Embrace of the Serpent
Description:
Remains in Play. All models in the unit take a S 3 hit. For every turn (friend and foe) the spell is
active, all models in the unit suffer another Hit each at the end of the Magic phase, with the S of the Attack increasing by 1 every turn.

Name: Siren's Dream
Description: Affects all enemy units within range. Until the start of the casterâ€™s next turn, these units suffer -1 to their A, S, and M value, down to a minimum of 1.

Name: Shifting Sands
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of the Desert is cast on an enemy unit, that unit must re-roll 6â€™s for their charge distance, when fleeing and when pursuing until the start of the next Arabyan magic phase.

Name: Sand Blast
Description: Causes D6/2D6 S 2 hits. The target reduces all their movement by half (rounding up) in their next movement phase.

Id: curse of the genie/lore of the desert
Name: Curse of the Genie
Description: The target must re-roll all successful To Wound rolls until the start of the casterâ€™s next magic phase.

Name: Mirage
Description: Remains in Play. Place a marker within 24" and Line of Sight of the target. While the spell is in effect, the target must turn and move directly towards the marker as fast as possible in the Movement phase, or target it with any missile weapons. If the marker is within charge range, the unit must declare a charge against it just as if it was an enemy unit. The spell is immediately dispelled if the target reaches the marker, has lost Line of Sight to it at the start of their Movement phase, hits it with any missile weapons or is engaged in close combat.

Name: Dancing Scimitar
Description: Causes D6/2D6 S 4 hits. Roll a D6 after resolving the damage; on a 3+, the Dancing Scimitar moves to another unengaged enemy unit within 8". Keep rolling until you make an unsuccessful attempt or run out of enemy units. Note that any unit cannot get hit more than once by the same Dancing Scimitar each turn.

Name: Sunstrike
Description: The spell shoots in a straight line from the caster's base. Each model under the line takes a S 5 hit with Flaming Attacks.

Name: Quicksand
Description: All models in the unit must take an I test. Those that fail must then take an armour save. If passed, they are dragged down into the sand and are removed as casualties, with no save allowed. Models without armour count as passing on a 6. This spell has no effect on models with the Fly, Ethereal or Strider.

Name: Sand Storm
Description: Remains in Play. Affects all units (friend and foe) within range. No units within the sand storm can use missile weapons, and war machines cannot fire. No units may be targeted by any missile attack. Flying units are restricted to their ground movement. Enemy units affected cannot march in their next movement phase.

Name: Metallic Attraction
Description: The casting difficulty for a Lore of Metal spell is lowered by 1 if the majority of the models in the target unit have light or medium armour, or lowered by 2 to if the majority have heavy or full plate armour.

Name: Searing Doom
Description: Causes D6/2D6 hits with Ignores Armour saves and Flaming Attacks. The To Wound score is equal to the unmodified armour save of the target (excluding Natural Armour). Models without an armour save cannot be wounded.

Name: Plague of Rust
Description: The target's armour save (excluding Natural Armour) is lowered by one point for the rest of the game (e.g. a model with light armour and shield will only have a 6+ save). Plague of Rust can be repeatedly cast on the same target, reducing its armour save by a further -1 each time.

Id: enchanted blades of aiban/lore of metal
Name: Enchanted Blades of Aiban
Description: The target unit (except mounts) has a +1 bonus when rolling to hit with all shooting and close combat attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. All of their attacks also count as both Magical Attacks and Armour Piercing (1).

Name: Glittering Robe
Description: The target unit has Natural Armour (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Gehenna's Golden Hounds
Description: Choose a single enemy model within range â€“ it suffers D6 S 5 hits (even a character in a unit).

Name: Transmutation of Lead
Description: The target suffers a -1 penalty to its WS, BS and armour saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Final Transmutation
Description: Roll a D6 for every model in the target unit â€“ on a 5+ it is removed as a casualty, with no saves except Magic Resistance allowed. Models with more than one wound on their profile are only affected on a roll of 6. In addition, any enemy unit within 12" of the target at the start of their following turn (including the target itself) must test for Stupidity. This does not apply to models with Immunity (Psychology), War Beasts, Monstrous Beasts or Monsters.

Name: Cascading Fire-Cloak
Description: Remains in play. At the end of each Magic phase, any enemy unit in base contact with the target immediately suffers 2D6 S 4 hits.

Id: flaming sword of rhuin/lore of fire
Name: Flaming Sword of Rhuin
Description: The target unit (except mounts) has a +1 bonus when rolling To Wound with all shooting and close combat attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. The target unit also counts as having both Magical Attacks and Flaming Attacks.

Name: The Burning Head
Description: Extend a straight line, within the caster's front arc and directly away from their base. Each model in the way (determined as for a bouncing cannonball) suffers a S 4 hit. A unit that suffers one or more casualties from the Burning Head must take a Panic test.

Id: piercing bolts of burning/lore of fire
Name: Piercing Bolts of Burning
Description: Causes D3 S 4 hits for each rank (including incomplete ranks) in the target unit.

Name: Fulminating Flame Cage
Description:
The target unit immediately suffers D6 S 4 hits. In addition, if the target unit moves during the Movement phase, flees or pursues, every model in the unit suffers an immediate S 4 hit and the spell
ends. If the unit does not move, Fulminating Flame Cage automatically ceases at the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Flame Storm
Description: Place the small/large round template anywhere within range of the Wizard â€“ it then scatters D6/2D6". All models hit by the template suffer a S 4 hit.

Name: Primal Onslaught
Description: If a spell from the Lore of the Wild is cast, all friendly units with the Primal Fury in range may roll an additional dice for their Primal Fury tests in the ensuing close combat phase and discard the highest dice.

Name: Bestial Surge
Description: Affects all nonfleeing friendly units within range. If cast, all units will immediately make a move straight forward following the rules for Random Movement (D6+1).

Name: Viletide
Description: Inflicts 5D6 S 1 hits.

Name: Devolve
Description: Affects all enemy units within range. All effected enemy units must take a LD test. If the test is failed, the unit suffers a number of wounds equal to the amount the test was failed by, with the Ignores Armour saves special rule.

Name: Bray-Scream
Description: The caster makes a Breath Weapon Attack with S 4/5.This may be cast in close combat, following the normal rules for Breath Weapons.

Name: Traitor-Kin
Description: Affects all enemy Cavalry, Monstrous Cavalry, Chariots, ridden Monsters as well as War Beasts with Mixed Unit within range. All affected models will suffer a number of hits equal to the S and A characteristics of their mount/carriage animal. Any armour save bonuses for the beastâ€™s Natural Armour, barding etc, have no effect.

Id: mantle of ghorok/lore of the wild
Name: Mantle of Ghorok
Description: Can be cast on a friendly Character, including the Wizard itself. The character (but not any mount) gains +D6 S and +D6 A (both to a maximum of 10) until the start of the caster's next magic phase. Additionally, if one or more 6s are rolled, the model also suffers a S 5 Hit with no saves of any kind possible.

Name: Savage Dominion
Description: Is cast on the Wizard itself. The Wizard may summon one of the following Monsters: Ghorgon, Jabberslythe or Chaos Giant. Immediately place a model representing the beast, with its base touching any table edge. This model is effectively part of the Beastman army from that moment on. Every time the beast suffers a wound, the Wizard that summoned it must make a Toughness test. If this is failed, the Wizard takes a wound too, with no saves of any kind possible. If the Wizard is killed, the beast wanders back into the forest and is immediately removed from play (it counts as being killed for the purposes of victory conditions etc.). Note that the beast cannot be voluntarily dismissed by the Wizard, or dispelled by the enemy in following rounds. In addition, only one monster may be summoned by the same Wizard at any one time.

Id: bloated with disease/lore of nurgle bm/woc 2
Name: Bloated with Disease
Description: When a spell from the Lore of Nurgle is successfully cast, roll a D6 after resolving the spell's effect(s). On the roll of a 6, the Wizardâ€™s Wounds are increased by 1 for the remainder of the game.

Id: stream of corruption/lore of nurgle bm/woc 2
Name: Stream of Corruption
Description: The caster makes a Breath Weapon Attack. This may be cast in close combat, following the normal rules for Breath Weapons. All models Hit must pass a T test or suffer a Wound with Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Miasma of Pestilence
Description: Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, all enemy units in base contact with the target unit reduce their WS and I by 1 (to a minimum of 1). Boosted version reduces WS and I by D3 (roll once and apply the result to all affected enemies).

Name: Blades of Putrification
Description: The target unit's close combat attacks gain Poisoned Attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If a model targeted by this spell already has Poisoned Attacks, its Attacks also wound the target automatically on a To Hit roll of 6.

Id: curse of the leper/lore of nurgle
Name: Curse of the Leper
Description: Can be cast on any unit (friend or foe) within range. If cast on a friendly unit, Curse of the Leper is an Augment spell that increases the target unit's T by D3 (to a maximum of 10) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If Curse of the Leper is cast on an enemy unit, it is a Hex spell that reduces the target unit's T by D3 (to a minimum of 1) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Rancid Visitations
Description: Inflicts D6 S 5 hits. The target unit must then immediately pass a T test or suffer a further D6 S 5 hits. The target must keep testing its T in this manner until a test is passed, or the target is removed as a casualty.

Name: Fleshy Abundance
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, the target has Regeneration (5+) (to a maximum of a 3+ save for Daemons of Nurgle).

Name: Plague Wind
Description:
Remains in play. Plague Wind uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates the direction in which the Plague Wind will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply the result by the caster's Wizard level. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster instead and roll a scatter dice; the template moves a number of inches equal to the caster's Wizard level, in the direction shown by the scatter dice (if you roll a Hit!, the template remains where it is). Any model touched by the template must pass a T test or suffer a single automatic Wound, which Ignores Armour saves.

In subsequent turns, the Plague Wind travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll of an artillery dice (if a misfire is rolled, the Plague Wind dissipates and is removed).

Id: bliss in torment/lore of slaanesh bm/woc 4
Name: Bliss in Torment
Description: When a spell from the Lore of Slaanesh is successfully cast, roll a D6, plus one D6 for each unsaved Wound caused by the spell (if any). For each result of a 6 rolled, the Wizardâ€™s WSl, I and A are increased by 1 until the start of his next Magic phase.

Id: lash of slaanesh/lore of slaanesh bm/woc 4
Name: Lash of Slaanesh
Description: Extend a straight line 24" in length, within the caster's forward arc and directly from his base. Any model whose base falls under the line (determined as for a bouncing cannonball) suffers a S 4 hit with Armour Piercing (1). Any unit that suffers a casualty from this spell may not march in its next Movement phase.

Name: Acquiescence
Description: The target unit is subject to Always Strikes Last and Random Movement (D6) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Pavane of Slaanesh
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). If successfully cast, the target must pass a LD test on 3D6. If failed, the target suffers 1 Wound which Ignores Armour saves for every point they failed the LD test by.

Name: Hysterical Frenzy
Description: Remains in play. Hysterical Frenzy can be cast on any unit (friend or foe) within range. If cast on a friendly unit, Hysterical Frenzy is an Augment spell. If Hysterical Frenzy is cast on an enemy unit, it is a Hex spell. For the duration of the spell, the target gains Frenzy (which is not lost if the unit is defeated in close combat). If the target unit already has Frenzy, that Frenzy grants +2 Ainstead of just +1. In addition, for the duration of the spell, the target of Hysterical Frenzy suffers D6 S 3 hits at the end of each of the caster's Magic phases.

Name: Slicing Shards
Description: Inflicts D6 S 4 hits with Armour Piercing (1). The target must then immediately pass a LD test, or suffer a further D6 S 4 hits with Armour Piercing (1). The target must keep testing its LD in this manner until a test is passed, or the target is removed as a casualty.

Name: Phantasmagoria
Description: Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target unit must roll an additional D6 whenever it takes a LD test, discarding the lowest result rolled.

Name: Cacophonic Choir
Description: The target unit takes 2D6 hits that wound on a 4+ and Ignore Armour saves. If at least one unsaved Wound is caused, the target unit is subject to Always Strikes Last and Random Movement (D6) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: boon of magic/lore of tzeentch bm/woc 2
Name: Boon of Magic
Description: When a spell from the Lore of Tzeentch is successfully cast, make a note of how many power dice results were a 6. After resolving the spellâ€™s effect(s), you immediately add a single power dice to your armyâ€™s pool for each result of a 6 that was rolled to cast the spell.

Id: blue fire of tzeentch/lore of tzeentch bm/woc 2
Name: Blue Fire of Tzeentch
Description: Causes D6 S D6+1 hits with Flaming Attacks.

Name: Pandemonium
Description: Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target unit must use the lowest LD value in the unit (including that of mounts) and cannot benefit from Inspiring Presence or Hold Your Ground!. This spell has no effect on units with Immunity (Psychology). The boosted version affects all enemy units within range.

Id: pink fire of tzeentch/lore of tzeentch
Name: Pink Fire of Tzeentch
Description: Place the teardrop-shaped template with its narrow end touching the front of the Wizard's base and the large end aimed at the target. Roll 2D6 and move the template directly forwards the number of inches indicated. All models underneath the template suffer a S D6+1 hit with Flaming Attacks (roll once for the S and use that value for all hits).

Name: Bolt of Change
Description: Inflicts a single S D6+4 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3), Ignores Armour Saves and Flaming Attacks, and then penetrates ranks in the same manner as a shot from a bolt thrower.

Name: Glean Magic
Description: Targets a single enemy Wizard within range. The caster and the target both roll a D6 and add their Wizard level to the score. If the target's total is higher than the caster's, nothing happens. Otherwise, the target suffers a S 4 hit with Flaming Attacks, loses one Wizard level (to a minimum of 0) and forgets one randomly determined spell (this cannot be a bound spell). If the caster does not already know this spell, they immediately gain it and can cast it just like any of his other spells. When casting a stolen spell, always substitute its lore attribute with the Lore of Tzeentch's lore attribute.

Name: Treason of Tzeentch
Description: All models in the unit immediately make one close combat attack against the unit itself. Roll To Hit, To Wound and take saves as normal. The caster may choose which of the unit's weapons is used for these attacks, though any Parry or Dodge save does not apply, and neither does any special rules that only applies in the first round of close combat. This spell has no effect on single model units.

Name: Infernal Gateway
Description: The target suffers 2D6 S 2D6 hits with Flaming Attacks. Roll for the S first. If an 11 or 12 is rolled when determining the spell's S value, the hits are resolved at S 10, and the unit suffers 3D6 hits rather than 2D6.

Id: favour of the lady/lore of the lady 4
Name: Favour of the Lady
Description: If a spell from the Lore of the Lady is successfully cast on a friendly unit, it may re-roll 1â€™s for Ward saves from the Blessing until the start of the next Bretonnian Magic phase.

Id: steed of the lady/lore of the lady 4
Name: Steed of the Lady
Description: The target unit will have M 10 and counts as Ethereal for the purposes of movement until the start of the next Bretonnian Magic phase. This spell only has an effect on mounted Knights.

Name: Equilibrium
Description: When choosing their spells, the wizard always gains both the Ying and Yan version of each spell. Every other successfully cast spell must be from the other energy type or the wizard suffers a Miscast on the roll of any double.

Id: warrior incarnate (yan)/lore of ying and yan 3
Name: Warrior Incarnate (Yan)
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, the chosen unit gains Frenzy and Hatred.

Id: ancestor's courage (ying)/lore of ying and yan 3
Name: Ancestor's Courage (Ying)
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, the chosen unit gains Stubborn and Immunity (Psychology).

Id: sapping of will (ying)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Sapping of Will (Ying)
Description: All models in the targeted unit are subject to Always Strikes Last and suffer -1 to their WS.

Id: strength of the heavens (yan)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Strength of the Heavens (Yan)
Description: All models in the target unit gain +1 to their S and Magical Attacks. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: flames of azure (yan)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Flames of Azure (Yan)
Description: Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target unit gains Flaming Attacks, and all enemy models in base contact suffer a Flaming S 3 hit at the start of the close combat phase, which counts toward combat resolution. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: absorbing chill (ying)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Absorbing Chill (Ying)
Description: Enemies attacking the target unit suffer -1 to Wound until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: blazing phoenix (ying)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Blazing Phoenix (Ying)
Description: Targets all enemy units within range. The target units suffer D6 Flaming S 4 hits.

Id: call of the dragon (yan)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Call of the Dragon (Yan)
Description: The caster makes a Breath Weapon Attack with S 4 and Flaming Attacks. This may be cast in close combat, following the normal rules for Breath Weapons.

Id: bereavement of life (ying)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Bereavement of Life (Ying)
Description: Causes 3D6 hits. Each hit causes a Wound which Ignores Armour Saves on the roll of a natural 6.

Id: resurgence from death (yan)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Resurgence from Death (Yan)
Description: The targeted unit gains Regeneration (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: path of light (yan)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Path of Light (Yan)
Description: The targeted unit immediately moves forward their M value plus 2D6" as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase, using Strider.

Id: shroud of darkness (ying)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Shroud of Darkness (Ying)
Description: The target unit will have its line of sight limited to 8" until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. They cannot declare charges, cast spells or shoot at targets outside this range.

Id: meteor rain (yan)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Meteor Rain (Yan)
Description: Place a marker anywhere within range and roll 2D6/3D6. The result is the radius in inches that will be struck by the Meteor Rain. Any unit within that radius takes 2D6 S 4 hits.

Id: earth eruption (ying)/lore of ying and yan
Name: Earth Eruption (Ying)
Description: Place the small/large template anywhere within range â€“ it then scatters D6"/2D6". Models partially covered take a S 4 hit. Models wholly covered take a S 6 Hit.

Name: Killing Fire
Description: Once a spell from the Lore of Hashut has been cast on an enemy unit, that unit counts as being Flammable for the remainder of the Magic phase.

Name: Breath of Hatred
Description: The target unit gains Hatred until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Burning Wrath
Description: Causes D6/2D6 S 6 hits with Flaming Attacks.

Name: Dark Subjugation
Description: The target unit must pass a LD test at -3 or suffer a permanent reduction of -1 to their LD for the rest of the game (to a minimum of 2). This has no effect on models with Immunity (Psychology).

Name: Curse of Hashut
Description: Targets a single enemy model of the caster's choice (even a character in a unit). The target suffers a number of hits equal to 2D6 minus their T value. Hits from this spell Wound on a 4+ with Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Ash Storm
Description:
The target unit suffers -1 To Hit in close combat and -2 To Hit with missile attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. In addition, the target unit may only use its basic move and may not charge, march or Fly. The unit also treats all terrain (except impassable terrain) as dangerous terrain while the spell's effect lasts. Wizards cannot cast magic spells (except their own unit) while
under the effect of this spell. Any unit under the effect of the spell is treated as being Flammable.

Name: Hell Hammer
Description: Extend a straight line within the caster's front arc and directly away from their base. Each model in the way must take an I test or suffer a S 6 hit with Flaming Attacks Multiple Wounds (D3). Any unit suffering casualties from this spell must immediately take a Panic test.

Name: Flames of Azgorh
Description: May be cast on any point on the table within the caster's line of sight. Place the small/large round template with the central hole on the chosen target point â€“ the template then scatters D6". All models touched by the template suffer a S 6 hit with Flaming Attacks and Multiple Wounds (D6). In addition, the model directly under the hole in the template must take a T test at -2 or be slain outright with no saves.

Id: fires of change/lore of tzeentch doc 1
Name: Fires of Change
Description: When a Daemon casts a spell from the Lore of Tzeentch that causes one or more unsaved Wounds, choose a unit of Pink Horrors or Screamers within range of the caster, and roll a D6 for each Wound caused. If it is a unit of Pink Horrors, add 1 model to the unit for each result of 5+. If it is a unit of Screamers, add 1 model to the unit for each result of 6. Models are added, one at a time, to the back rank. If the back rank is full at any point, or the unit has a single rank of at least five models, the next model starts a new back rank. Models that cannot be placed (because there isn't enough room, or you do not have sufficient models) are lost. Models created in this way have no upgrades and do not award additional victory points.

Id: born of damnation/lore of slaanesh doc 2
Name: Born of Damnation
Description: When a Daemon casts a spell from the Lore of Slaanesh that causes one or more unsaved Wounds, choose a unit of Daemonettes or Fiends of Slaanesh within range of the caster, and roll a D6 for each Wound caused. If it is a unit of Daemonettes, add 1 model to the unit for each result of 5+. If it is a unit of Fiends, add 1 model to the unit for each result of 6. Models are added, one at a time, to the back rank. If the back rank is full at any point, or the unit has a single rank of at least five models, the next model starts a new back rank. Models that cannot be placed (because there isn't enough room, or you do not have sufficient models) are lost. Models created in this way have no upgrades and don't award additional victory points.

Id: children of nurgle/lore of nurgle doc 1
Name: Children of Nurgle
