Description: When a Daemon casts a spell from the Lore of Nurgle that causes one or more unsaved Wounds, choose a unit of Plaguebearers or Nurglings within range of the caster, and roll a D6 for each Wound caused. If it is a unit of Plaguebearers, add 1 model to the unit for each result of 5+. If it is a unit of Nurglings, add 1 base to the unit for each result of 6. Models are added, one at a time, to the back rank. If the back rank is full at any point, or the unit has a single rank of at least five models, the next model starts a new back rank. Models that cannot be placed (because there isn't enough room, or you do not have sufficient models) are lost. Models created in this way have no upgrades and don't award additional victory points.

Name: Spiteful Conjuration
Description: When a Wizard successfully casts a hex, magic missile or direct damage spell from this lore, and the casting roll contains any double, the spell's target suffers 2D6 S 2 hits with Armour Piercing (1). If the casting roll contains any treble, the spell's target instead suffers 3D6 hits instead. In either case, the hits are resolved after the spell has been resolved.

Id: power of darkness/lore of dark magic 3
Name: Power of Darkness
Description: All models in the target unit have a +1 bonus to their S until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Then add D3 power dice to your power pool. If a natural 6 is rolled when generating these power dice, the caster suffers a Wound which Ignores Armour saves.

Id: doombolt of kharaidon/lore of dark magic 3
Name: Doombolt of Kharaidon
Description: Causes D6/2D6 S 5 hits.

Id: nagaelythe the chillwind/lore of dark magic
Name: Nagaelythe the Chillwind
Description: Causes 2D6 S 2 hits. If the target suffers any unsaved Wounds, all models in the unit suffer a -1 penalty to their BS until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: chroesh - word of pain/lore of dark magic
Name: Chroesh - Word of Pain
Description: All models in the target unit suffer -D3 to both their WS and BS until the start of the caster's next Magic phase (roll once for both). Boosted version also inflicts the -D3 penalty to their S and I (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Bladewind
Description: Every model in the target unit must pass a WS test or suffer a S 4 hit with Armour Piercing (1).

Id: shroud of despair/lore of dark magic
Name: Shroud of Despair
Description: Targets all enemy units within range. Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the targets cannot benefit from the Hold Your Ground! or Inspiring Presence rules. In addition, whenever a target unit fails a LD test of any kind, all target units (including the one that failed) suffer -1 to their LD until the start of the caster's next Magic phase (this effect is cumulative with itself).

Id: anchan-rogar the soul stealer/lore of dark magic
Name: Anchan-Rogar the Soul Stealer
Description: Place the small round template anywhere within range of the Wizard â€“ it then scatters D6". All models hit by the template suffer a S 2 hit with no armour saves allowed. Roll a D6 for each unsaved Wound inflicted by Soul Stealer. For each roll of 4+, the caster immediately gains a single Wound (to a maximum of 10).

Id: arnzipal's black horror/lore of dark magic
Name: Arnzipal's Black Horror
Description: Remains in play. Uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates a direction in which the Black Horror will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply the result by the caster's Wizard level. Any model touched by, or passed over by the template must pass a S test or be slain outright with no armour saves allowed. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster and roll both a scatter dice and a D6. The template moves a number of inches equal to the result of the D6, in the direction shown on the scatter dice (if you roll a Hit!, use the little arrow shown on the Hit! symbol). In either event, in subsequent turns, the Black Horror travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll on an artillery dice. If a misfire is rolled in subsequent turns, the Black Horror collapses in on itself and is removed.

Name: Ring of Luccina
Description: Affects all units within range". If successfully cast, all fleeing troops will Rally automatically.

Id: apotheosis/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Apotheosis
Description: The target immediately regains 1/D3 lost Wound. Note that this may not take the model above its starting value of Wounds. Regardless of how many lost Wounds (if any) are recovered, the target also gains Fear until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: hand of glory/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Hand of Glory
Description: The target unit's M, WS, BS or I (you choose which) is increased by D3 until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version increases all four characteristics (make one roll and apply it to all four characteristics).
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: walk between worlds/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Walk Between Worlds
Description: Targets a single unengaged unit within range. The target gains Ethereal until the end of the phase and can immediately move up to 10"/20" as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: tempest/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Tempest
Description: Place the large round template anywhere within 30" of the Wizard â€“ it then scatters D6". All models hit by the template suffer a S 3 hit (models with Fly suffer a S 4 hit instead). If a unit suffers any unsaved Wounds from this spell, it suffers a -1 modifier to all To Hit rolls (both shooting and close combat) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase (shooting attacks that do not use BS must roll 4+ on a D6 before firing, or the shot(s) are lost).
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: arcane unforging/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Arcane Unforging
Description: Targets a single enemy character (even if in a unit). The target suffers a single Wound which Ignores Armour saves on a dice roll greater than or equal to the model's unmodified armour save (excluding Natural Armour, models without an armour save cannot be wounded). The owning player must then reveal to the caster all the magic items possessed by the target (if any). If the target has one or more magic items, randomly select one of them â€“ that item is immediately destroyed on the roll of 2+ and cannot be used for the rest of the game. Note that this spell has no effect on magic items that are mounts, magic items that contain bound spells that have miscast during the game, and any magic items labelled as 'one use only' that have already been used during the game â€“ do not include these when randomly selecting a magic item.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: fiery convocation/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Fiery Convocation
Description: Remains in Play. Every model in the target unit takes a S 4 hit with Flaming Attacks. At the end of every subsequent Magic phase, every model in the target unit suffers a S 4 hit with Flaming Attacks.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: contemplations/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Contemplations
Description: If a spell from the Lore of High Magic is successfully cast by a Wizard from Warhammer: Lizardmen, the caster can immediately choose a new spell of the same level or lower from one of the eight Lores of Magic in the Warhammer rulebook which will last for the remainder of the Magic phase. If the Wizard chooses a spell from a different lore, that newly chosen spell will always use that spell lore's lore attribute.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: soul quench/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Soul Quench
Description: Causes 2D6/3D6 S 4 hits.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: drain magic/lore of high magic lm 4 loremaster
Name: Drain Magic
Description: If the target is a friendly unit, Drain Magic is an augment spell. If the target is an enemy unit, Drain Magic is a hex spell. In either case, all Remains in Play spells affecting the target unit are immediately dispelled, and the effects of all other spells on the target unit immediately come to an end. Boosted version targets all units (friend and foe) within range.
PathName: Lore of High Magic LM 4 Loremaster

Id: shield of saphery/lore of high magic he 4 alarielle
Name: Shield of Saphery
Description: Each time a spell from this lore is successfully cast, the caster and their unit immediately gain a Ward save (6+) (which can then be increased by further castings thanks to this lore attribute) until the beginning of the caster's next Magic phase.
PathName: Lore of High Magic HE 4 Alarielle

Name: Spirit Wisdom
Description: Whenever the caster rolls any double while successfully casting a spell, he gains knowledge of one additional random spell from the Lore of Spirits for the duration of the Magic phase.

Name: Spirit Staff
Description: The target unit gains +1 S, Killing Blow and Magical Attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Message of Doom
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next magic phase, the target unit must test for Fear against all enemies and suffer -1 to their LD.

Name: Spirits' Voice
Description: The target unit may re-roll failed rolls To Hit and failed LD tests until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Fire of Vengeance
Description: Causes 2D6 S 4 hits with Flaming Attacks.

Id: power of the wind/lore of spirits
Name: Power of the Wind
Description: Remains in play. Power of the Wind uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, roll 3D6 to determine how many inches the template moves. Any model touched by the template must pass a S test or suffer a S 4 hit with no armour save allowed. In subsequent turns, roll the scatter dice to determine the direction the cyclone moves.

Name: Spirit Shield
Description: The target unit gains Ward save (5+) and may re-roll failed armour saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Blades of Begtsethulu
Description: Affects all enemy units within range. For each complete rank the units have, they suffer D6 close combat Attacks made with WS 4 and S 4, distributed as shooting attacks.

Name: Karma
Description: Once per casting attempt, a Guru using this Lore may change a result of 1 on a dice roll to a 6. However, the next time he rolls a 6 when casting a spell, this roll must be substituted for a 1 instead.

Name: Tantra
Description: The target unit gains Always Strike First until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: creation of brahmir/lore of the devas
Name: Creation of Brahmir
Description: The target unit gains +1 to their S and Magical Attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: ganeshan's blessing of fortune/lore of the devas
Name: Ganeshan's Blessing of Fortune
Description: The target unit may re-roll D3 dice that directly affects them until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: sacred shield of vaishna/lore of the devas
Name: Sacred Shield of Vaishna
Description: The target unit gains Ward save (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Id: bolts of cindra/lore of the devas
Name: Bolts of Cindra
Description: Roll a D3/D6; this is the number of bolts summoned. Place this number of small templates anywhere within 24" of the Guru (but at least 1" apart). Each template will scatter D6+2". Any model touched by the template takes a S 4 hit, while any model under the hole takes a S 10 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3).

Id: curse of kali-ma/lore of the devas
Name: Curse of Kali-ma
Description: One chosen enemy model must take a LD test. If failed, the model suffers D6 Wounds, with no saves of any kind allowed.

Id: invocation of shaivi/lore of the devas
Name: Invocation of Shaivi
Description: The target unit will Wound on a 2+ with Ignores Armour Saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Curse
Description: If a spell from the Lore of the Hags is successfully cast on an enemy unit, that unit must re-roll 6â€™s when rolling to Hit until the start of the casters next Magic phase.

Id: curse of misfortune/lore of the hags 4
Name: Curse of Misfortune
Description: The target fails all Dangerous Terrain tests on a 1-2 instead of just 1, suffer -1 to Hit in close combat and with missile weapons, and in the case of Characters, no unit may use their LD.

Name: Fortune Told
Description: May be cast on the wizard herself. Until the start of the casterâ€™s next magic phase, all models in the same unit as the Hag may re-roll failed rolls To Hit in close combat and with missile weapons and gain Ward save (6+).

Id: form of the ancient widow/lore of the hags
Name: Form of the Ancient Widow
Description: Remains in play. May be cast on the wizard herself. While active, she gains Terror and Armour Piercing (1), +3 S, +2 T and +3 A. The effects of all magic items are ignored for the duration of this spell. While in this form, she follows all the rules for Monstrous Beasts.

Name: Cursed Pledge
Description: You may force the unit to do one of the following; make a normal move (including marching and reforming), or shoot with their missile weapons at a friendly target. If the unit refuses do to either of these things, each model in it suffers a S 4 hit.

Id: curse of sickness/lore of the hags
Name: Curse of Sickness
Description: Place the small/large template anywhere within range â€“ it scatters D6"/2D6". Models touched by the template must take a T test or suffer one wound, which Ignores Armour saves.

Name: Hag's Curse
Description: Remains in play. The first turn this spell is active, the target unit suffer -1 to their WS, BS and I, the second they suffer â€“1 to their S and T, the third -2 to their M and LD. On the fourth turn, they may not attack or move voluntarily for the rest of the game. Each effect is permanent even after the spell has been dispelled, and any further times the spell is cast it starts off where it was when dispelled.

Name: Summon Spirits
Description: Causes 3D6 Strength 2/3 Armour Piercing (1) hits.

Name: Numbing Cold
Description: If a spell from the Lore of Ice is successfully cast on an enemy unit, that unit suffers -1 to their WS and BS until the start of the casters next Magic phase.

Name: Shardstorm
Description: Causes 2D6 S 3/4 hits.

Id: form of the frostfiend/lore of ice
Name: Form of the Frostfiend
Description: Remains in play. May be cast on the wizard herself as long as she is on foot. While active, she gains Fly and Terror, +2 S, +2 T and +3 A. The effects of all magic items are ignored for the duration of this spell, as they are transmogrified along with the caster. While in this form, she follows all the rules for Monstrous Beasts.

Name: Ice Armour
Description: The unit adds +2 to their armour saves until the beginning of the next casterâ€™s Magic phase. However, it has no effect against Flaming Attacks. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Freezing Blast
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next turn, the target counts as moving through Dangerous Terrain, regardless of they move or not. If the unit is standing in a water feature at the time, they are frozen solid and cannot move for the rest of the game unless they have â€“ or are attacked by â€“ Flaming Attacks.

Name: Midwinter's Kiss
Description: Place the Flame template with the point touching the base of the caster. Models touched by the template takes a S 5 hit which Ignores Armour saves. The spell can be cast in close combat as well, in which case it causes 2D6 hits.

Id: gift of the winter wind/lore of ice
Name: Gift of the Winter Wind
Description: The targeted unit must pass a LD test using 3D6 and using the two highest dice. If failed, each model in the unit must take a S test or be removed as a casualty, with no saves allowed.

Id: invocation of the ice storm/lore of ice 4 loremaster
Name: Invocation of the Ice Storm
Description: The caster nominates a point on the battlefield. Roll an Artillery dice and double the result - this is the distance in inches (measured from the nominated point) that the Ice Storm affects. If a Misfire is rolled, it affects the entire battlefield. Until the start of the caster's next magic phase, all units caught in the Ice Storm suffer -2 to hit with missile weapons, and units that do not fire using BS can only fire by rolling a 4+ on a D6. In addition, all units inside the radius of the Ice Storm suffer 2D6 S 2 hits.

Id: invocation of the kami/lore of the kami 4
Name: Invocation of the Kami
Description: The caster may attempt to appease the Kami at the start of the Magic phase by passing a LD test. If passed, the caster may add +1 to their casting roll for every double rolled when casting a spell. If failed however, they will take a S 4 hit which Ignores Armour Saves.

Id: light of the sun goddess/lore of the kami 4
Name: Light of the Sun Goddess
Description: Causes D6 S 4 hits. Enemies that suffer a casualty suffer -1 to their WS and BS until the start of the casterâ€™s next magic phase.

Id: be the mountain/lore of the kami
Name: Be the Mountain
Description: Remains in play. Whilst the spell is in effect, the affected unit will be Stubborn. Boosted version also gives Natural Armour (5+).

Id: strike of the flowing waters/lore of the kami
Name: Strike of the Flowing Waters
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, the target unit gains Always Strikes First, and the enemy must re-roll successful armour save roll of 6's. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Fiery Wrath
Description: Targets the D3/D6 closest enemy units of the caster as long as they are within range of the caster. Each unit suffer D6 S 4 hits. These are Flaming Attacks.

Id: borne on the wind/lore of the kami
Name: Borne on the Wind
Description: The target unit may immediately make a move using Fly (10) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase.

Id: void of emptiness/lore of the kami
Name: Void of Emptiness
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next turn, the affected unit may not move at all in its next Movement phase and gains Immunity (Psychology).

Id: call of the war god/lore of the kami
Name: Call of the War God
Description: Targets all friendly units with Way of the Warrior within range of the caster. Until the start of the casterâ€™s next turn, the target units gain Devastating Charge and may re-roll all failed rolls To Wound in close combat.

Id: bullgorger/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Bullgorger
Description: The target has +1 S until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: bonecrusher/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Bonecrusher
Description: Causes 2D6 S 2 hits which Ignores Armour saves.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: toothcracker/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Toothcracker
Description: The target has +1 T until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: braingobbler/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Braingobbler
Description: The target must take a Panic test. Units with Immunity (Psychology) cannot be targeted by this spell.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: trollguts/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Trollguts
Description: The target has Regeneration (4+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: the maw/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: The Maw
Description:
Place the small/large round template anywhere within 18" of the caster. Roll the artillery dice and the scatter dice. Unless a Hit! is rolled, move the template the distance shown on the artillery dice, in the direction shown on the scatter dice.

If a misfire is rolled, centre the template on the caster and roll a scatter dice and a D6/2D6. The template moves the number of inches equal to the result of the D6/2D6, in the direction shown on the scatter dice (if you roll a Hit!, use the little arrow shown on the Hit! symbol).

Once the final position of the template is determined, all models under the template must take an I test. Models that pass the test suffer a S 3 hit. Models that fail the test suffer a S 7 hit with Multiple Wounds (D6).
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: bloodgruel/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Bloodgruel
Description: Roll a D6 immediately after resolving the effects of a successfully cast spell from the Lore of the Great Maw. On a roll of 2-6, the Wizard that cast the spell recovers one lost Wound (up to his starting number of Wounds), and adds +1 to the total rolled on the dice the next time he attempts to cast or dispel a spell. On a roll of 1 the Wizard that cast the spell suffers a S 6 hit.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: spinemarrow/lore of the great maw 4 loremaster
Name: Spinemarrow
Description: The target has Stubborn until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
PathName: Lore of the Great Maw 4 Loremaster

Id: gaze of mork/lore of the big waaagh! 1
Name: Gaze of Mork
Description: Extend a straight line, within the Shaman's forward arc and directly away from his base. Any model whose base falls under the line suffers a S 4 hit.

Id: power of da waaagh!/lore of the savage waaagh! 4
Name: Power of da Waaagh!
Description: For each friendly Orc (any type) unit in close combat within range of the Shaman, he adds +1 to his casting roll. Conversely, for each friendly Orc unit fleeing within range of the caster, he suffers -1 to his casting roll.

Id: bone krusha/lore of the savage waaagh! 4
Name: Bone Krusha
Description: The closer the target is to the caster, the more powerful the attack will be: if the target is within 6" of the caster, it suffers 2D6 S 5 Hits; if the target is between 6" and 12" away, it instead suffers D6 S 5 Hits; if the target is more than 12" away, it only suffers D3 S 5 Hits.

Id: wrath of gork/lore of the big waaagh!
Name: Wrath of Gork
Description: Inflicts D6 S 5 hits for every friendly unit of 5 or more Orc models (of any race) within 6" of the caster.

Id: fists of gork/lore of the big waaagh!
Name: Fists of Gork
Description: The target unit gains +1 S until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: 'Eadbutt
Description: One enemy Wizard within range suffers a S 4 hit that inflicts Multiple Wounds (D3), which Ignores Armour saves.

Id: 'ere we go!/lore of the big waaagh!
Name: 'Ere we go!
Description: Targets all Orc units (of any kind) that are in range, including the Shaman himself. The target units may re-roll To Hit rolls in close combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: WAAAGH!
Description: Affects all friendly Orc units (of any type) with 5 or more models within range. The target units will immediately make a move using Random Movement (2D6) towards the nearest enemy unit within Line of Sight â€“ if no enemy units are within Line of Sight, they will move directly forward instead. Note that no unit may be moved more than once per Magic phase with this spell.

Id: foot of gork/lore of the big waaagh!
Name: Foot of Gork
Description: Place the small template within range of the Shaman. It then scatters D6", maintaining the same facing. All models hit by the template suffer a S 6 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3). If the spell is boosted roll a dice and consult the Foot of Gork table after resolving the effects of the spell.

Id: kunnin' beast spirits/lore of the savage waaagh!
Name: Kunnin' Beast Spirits
Description: Targets Orcs (of any type). Your opponent must re-roll all To Hit rolls of 6 that target the unit with missile attacks and in close combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Orcs (of any type) within range.

Id: brutal beast spirits/lore of the savage waaagh!
Name: Brutal Beast Spirits
Description:
Targets Orcs (of any type).  The unit adds +1 M to any charge move it makes, and gains +1 To Hit in close
combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Orcs (of any type) within range.

Id: breath of mork/lore of the savage waaagh!
Name: Breath of Mork
Description: Target an unengaged unit. This unit may immediately make a normal Fly move (not march) as if it was the Remaining Moves phase.

Id: squiggly curse/lore of the savage waaagh!
Name: Squiggly Curse
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). Roll a D6; on a 1 it has no effect, on a 2 to 3 that model suffers one Wound, on a 4 to 5 it suffers D3 Wounds and on a 6 it suffers D6 Wounds. These Wounds have Ignores Armour Saves. Each time a model is slain by Squiggly Curse, you can add +D3 to any further casting attempts made by the caster this Magic Phase.

Id: gork's war cry/lore of the savage waaagh!
Name: Gork's War Cry
Description: The target unit suffers D6 S 5 which Ignores Armour Saves and is stunned by the deafening roar. The target unit halves all their Movement and is subject to Always Strikes Last until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: the evil sun/lore of the savage waaagh!
Name: The Evil Sun
Description: Remains in play. Uses the small round template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates the direction in which The Evil Sun will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply it by the number of Orc units (of any kind) within 6" of the template's original position. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster and roll a scatter dice. The template then moves D6" in the direction shown (if you roll a Hit! use the little arrow shown on the Hit! symbol). Any model under or passed over by the template suffers a S 5 hit. In subsequent turns, The Evil Sun travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll on an artillery dice multiplied by the number of Orc units (of any kind) within 6" of the template. If a misfire is rolled in subsequent turns, The Evil Sun is removed.

Id: sneaky stealin' (bad moon)/lore of the bad moon 2
Name: Sneaky Stealin' (Bad Moon)
Description: When a Spell of da Bad Moon is successfully cast, and after its effects have been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-4 nothing happens, but on a roll of 5-6 you may take one dispel dice from the opponent's dispel pool and add it to your power pool. If there are no dice left in the opponent's dispel pool, then this lore attribute has no effect.

Id: vindictive glare/lore of the bad moon 2
Name: Vindictive Glare
Description: Causes 2D6/3D6 S 3 hits.

Id: squig lure/lore of the bad moon
Name: Squig Lure
Description: Affects units of Squigs (of any type) within range. The target units add an additional D6" to any move they make in the Movement phase (except Fleeing) and when pursuing; as well as gain Frenzy until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: itchy nuisance/lore of the bad moon
Name: Itchy Nuisance
Description: Roll a D6. The target unit immediately reduces its M and I by this number (to a minimum of 1), until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Troops with Random Movement reduce the number of dice they roll by D3 (to a minimum of 1D6), and their I by D6.

Id: the great green spite/lore of the bad moon
Name: The Great Green Spite
Description: Pick one friendly Goblin unit (of any type) within 12" of the caster; the target unit suffers D6 S 4 Hits if this friendly unit has a lower Unit Strength than 20, 2D6 S 4 Hits if the friendly unit has Unit Strength of 20 to 30, and 3D6 S 4 Hits if the friendly unit has a Unit Strength over 30. These Hits have Armour Piercing (1).

Id: night shroud/lore of the bad moon
Name: Night Shroud
Description: Targets all friendly units within range. Until the beginning of the caster's next Magic phase, enemies suffer -1 To Hit with missile weapons against these units. All models in any enemy unit that charges into base contact with the Shaman or the unit he is with while the spell is in effect must take a Dangerous Terrain test.

Id: call da moon/lore of the bad moon
Name: Call da Moon
Description: Place the small template with the centre anywhere within this range; it scatters and inflicts damage like a Stone Thrower. If a misfire is rolled, centre the template over the caster instead.

Id: curse of da bad moon/lore of the bad moon
Name: Curse of da Bad Moon
Description: Uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the caster nominates the direction in which it will move. Roll 4D6 to determine how many inches the template moves. In subsequent turns the template will move 3D6" in a random direction. Any model under or passed over by the template is cursed, and must pass a characteristic test or take a wound which Ignores Armour Saves. The type of characteristic test is determined by rolling on the Curse of da Bad Moon chart. Roll once each Magic phase, just before moving the template, and apply the result to all models affected by the curse in that Magic phase.

Id: sneaky stealin'/lore of the little waaagh! 1
Name: Sneaky Stealin'
Description: When a Spell of da Little Waaagh! is successfully cast, and after its effects have been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-4 nothing happens, but on a roll of 5-6 you may take one dispel dice from the opponent's dispel pool and add it to your power pool. If there are no dice left in the opponent's dispel pool, then this lore attribute has no effect.

Id: sneaky stabbin'/lore of the little waaagh! 1
Name: Sneaky Stabbin'
Description: Targets Goblins (of any race). The target unit's close combat attacks have Armour Piercing (1) and can re-roll all failed To Hit and To Wound rolls when attacking in close combat against an enemy's flank or rear until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Goblins (of any type) within range.

Id: brain bursta/lore of the little waaagh!
Name: Brain Bursta
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). The target suffers a S 5 hit.

Id: mork save uz!/lore of the little waaagh!
Name: Mork Save Uz!
Description: The target unit may re-roll all failed armour saves and Ward saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: gork'll fix it/lore of the little waaagh!
Name: Gork'll Fix It
Description: The target unit must re-roll any of its To Hit, To Wound and armour save rolls of 6 (in shooting and close combat) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: the hand of gork/lore of the little waaagh!
Name: The Hand of Gork
Description: Targets a single unengaged friendly unit. Remove a model from the front rank of the unit and place it anywhere within 3D6"/6D6" of its original position, facing in any direction. Remove the remainder of the unit from the battlefield and form them up around the first model so that the unit keeps its original formation and the first model maintains its original position in the unit (if the unit comprised just one model, such as a chariot or character, then this step is unnecessary). Models from the unit cannot be placed in impassable terrain, nor may they be placed within 1" of any other unit.

Id: nikkit! nikkit!/lore of the little waaagh!
Name: Nikkit! Nikkit!
Description: Targets a single enemy character (even a character in a unit). The target suffers D3 S 4 Hits which Ignores Armour Saves. If the target has one or more magic items, randomly select one of them â€“ that item is stolen on the roll of 3+. If the caster does not already have a magic item of this type they can now use it, otherwise it is destroyed.

Id: mork wants ya!/lore of the little waaagh!
Name: Mork Wants Ya!
Description: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). The target must pass an I test or suffer D6 S 10 hits.

Id: sneaky stealin' (spider god)/lore of the spider god 1
Name: Sneaky Stealin' (Spider God)
Description: When a Spell of da Spider God is successfully cast, and after its effects have been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-4 nothing happens, but on a roll of 5-6 you may take one dispel dice from the opponent's dispel pool and add it to your power pool. If there are no dice left in the opponent's dispel pool, then this lore attribute has no effect.

Id: venomous spiderlings/lore of the spider god 1
Name: Venomous Spiderlings
Description: The target unit suffers 3D6 S 1 Hits with Poisoned Attacks.

Id: deadly webbing/lore of the spider god
Name: Deadly Webbing
Description: Can be cast on any terrain feature within range. Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target counts as Dangerous Terrain for all non-flying movement and in addition, units cannot march while within it. This spell has no effect on Forest Goblins.

Id: chitinous armour/lore of the spider god
Name: Chitinous Armour
Description: Targets Goblins (of any type). The target unit gains Natural Armour (6+) until the start of the caster's next magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Goblins (of any type).within range.

Id: scuttling terrors/lore of the spider god
Name: Scuttling Terrors
Description:
Targets Goblins (of any type). The target unit may immediately make a Move as if it were the Remaining
Moves phase.

Id: sneaky distraction/lore of the spider god
Name: Sneaky Distraction
Description: Affects all enemy units within range of the caster. The target units suffer -1 To Hit with missile attacks and in close combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. This spell has no affect on models with Immunity (Psychology). Boosted version targets all enemy units within range.

Id: curse of da spider god/lore of the spider god
Name: Curse of da Spider God
Description: The target unit must re-roll successful To Hit rolls (in shooting and close combat) and armour saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: gift of the spider god/lore of the spider god
Name: Gift of the Spider God
Description: Targets Goblins (of any type). The target unit gains Poisoned Attacks and Regeneration (6+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If the unit already has Poisoned Attacks, the spell will boost its venom so that they wound the target automatically on a To Hit roll of 6. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Goblins (of any type) within range.

Id: kiss of the deep/lore of the deep 1
Name: Kiss of the Deep
Description:
Whenever a spell from the Lore of the Deep is cast on an enemy unit, that unit also suffer D6 S 1 Hits which Ignores
Armour Saves in addition to the effects of the spell.

Name: Tidecall
Description: The caster makes a S 2 Breath Weapon Attack. This may be cast in close combat, following the normal rules for Breath Weapons. Until the start of the caster's next Magic Phase, any unit Hit will suffer -D6" to any Move they make as well as being Disrupted.

Id: denizens of the deep/lore of the deep
Name: Denizens of the Deep
Description: Causes 2D6 S 3 hits.

Id: eye of the storm/lore of the deep
Name: Eye of the Storm
Description: Is cast on the Wizard and any unit they are with. Until the start of the caster's next Magic Phase, any missile fire directed from or against the Wizard or their unit suffer -1 To Hit. Any missile attacks that do not roll to Hit must first roll a 4+ on a D6 to be able to target the unit. Any unit in base contact with the Wizard or their unit suffer D6 S 5 Hits at the start of each Magic Phase.

Name: Watery Grave
Description: The target unit counts as moving through dangerous terrain until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. For every 4" the unit moves while the spell is in effect, the chance of them failing the test increases by +1.

Id: fog of the damned/lore of the deep
Name: Fog of the Damned
Description: Remains in Play. All models in the target unit suffer -1 to their WS and LD.

Name: Stromfels' Jaws
Description: Place the small/large template anywhere within range; it will scatter D6"/2D6". Any model touched by the template takes a S 5 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3).

Name: Kraken's Pull
Description:
Remains in Play.  Uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the player nominates the direction in which the Kraken's Pull will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll 3D6. Any model touched by the template must pass a S test or suffer 1 Wound with no Armour Saves allowed. Any surviving models will have their M value lowered by half until the start of the caster's next Magic Phase.

In subsequent turns, Kraken's Pull travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to 2D6. If a double is rolled in subsequent turns, Kraken's Pull is removed.

Name: Howling Warpgale
Description: Is cast on the wizard itself. Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, no units within range of the caster may use Fly, and all nonmagical missile attacks suffer -1 To Hit.

Name: Death Frenzy
Description: The target unit will immediately be affected by Frenzy. If the wizard casts this spell on a unit that already has Frenzy, the unit will be subject to Death Frenzy, giving them 2 extra attacks rather than the normal 1 from Frenzy. Units that are Death Frenzied suffer D6 automatic Wounds which Ignore Armour save at the end of each friendly turn. A unit that is Death Frenzied will go back to having normal Frenzy once they lose a round of close combat.

Name: Warpstorm
Description: Affects all units within range. Roll a D6 for each unit within range, including units in close combat. On a 4+, enemy units suffer D6 S 5 hits with Lightning Attacks. Friendly units are only affected on a 6.

Name: Flensing Ruin
Description: Targets a single model (even a character in a unit). The target suffers D3 S 6 Hits with Lightning Attacks.

Name: Scorch
Description: Place the small/large round template anywhere within range â€“ it then scatters D6"/2D6". All models underneath suffer a Flaming S 4 hit. Any unit that suffers an unsaved wound must take a Panic test.

Name: Cracks Call
Description: Trace a straight line from the base of the caster the number of inches rolled. All models in its path must pass an I test or be removed as casualties with no saves except Magic Resistance allowed. Instead of taking an I test, War Machines and Chariots must instead roll a 5+ or be destroyed. A building (or single section of a multi-part building) affected by the spell will collapse on a roll of 5+. If the building collapses, any models garrisoning it must pass an I test, or be removed as a casualty with no armour save allowed. Any survivors are placed outside the building, as described for a unit abandoning a building. Then replace the building with an area of dangerous terrain of equal size.

Name: Toxic Rain
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of Stealth is cast, all enemy units within range of the caster suffer a -1 penalty to their armour saves until the start of the caster's next magic phase.

Name: Skitterleap
Description: The target model (which must be an Infantry character) may immediately be placed anywhere on battlefield within 24" of the caster, but at least 1" away from enemy models.

Name: Warp Stars
Description: Causes D3/D6 S 5 hits with Multiple Wounds (D3).

Name: Stickypaws
Description: Can be cast on an Infantry unit. The target unit ignores Dangerous and Impassable Terrain (note that it may not end its move within 1" of it as normal) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Armour of Darkness
Description: Is cast on the Wizard itself. Until the start of the caster's next turn, all missile fire directed at the target unit suffers -1 To Hit. In addition, the unit adds +1 to their armour save. Boosted version targets all friendly units within range.

Name: Swiftscamper
Description: The target unit doubles its M rate (to a maximum of 10) and can re-roll their Charge, Flee and Pursuit results until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.

Name: Black Whirlwind
Description: Place the small round template anywhere within range â€“ it then scatters D6"/2D6". All models underneath the template suffer a S 3 hit. The unit then suffers -1 to their WS, BS and I until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: Veil of Shadows
Description:
Remains in Play. Uses the large template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates the direction in which the Veil of Shadows will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply the result by 3. Any model touched by the template takes a S 3 hit, and the unit will count as being Disrupted for the remainder of the turn.

If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster and roll a scatter dice and a D6. The template moves the number of inches equal to the result of the D6, in the direction shown on the scatter dice (if you roll a Hit!, use the little arrow shown on the Hit! symbol). In either event, in subsequent turns, the Veil of Shadows travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll on an artillery dice. If a misfire is rolled in subsequent turns, the Veil of Shadows is removed.

Name: Musk of Fear
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of Ruin is cast, all enemy units within range of the caster suffer -1 to their LD (to a minimum of 1) until the start of the caster's next magic phase.

Name: Warp Lightning
Description: Causes D6/2D6 S 5 hits with Lightning Attacks. If the number of hits rolled is a natural 1, then the caster suffers a S 5 hit instead of the target.

Name: Plague Rash
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of Plague is cast, all enemy units within range of the caster suffer -1 to their M and I (to a minimum of 1) until the start of the caster's next magic phase.

Name: Pestilent Breath
Description: The caster makes a S 2/3 Breath Attack which Ignores Armour save. This may be cast in close combat, following the normal rules for Breath Weapons.

Name: Bless with Filth
Description: The target gets Poisoned Attacks  until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If the unit already has Poisoned Attacks, the warriors will also cause an automatic wound on a To Hit roll of 6+.

Name: Weeping World Sores
Description: Place the small/large template anywhere within range; it scatters D6"/2D6". All models touched by the template suffer a S 2 Hit which Ignores Armour save.

Name: Vermintide
Description: Once the template is placed, it moves 4D6" in a straight line from the caster. Any unit touched by the template takes 3D6 S 2 hits. After this, the spell disappears. This spell may also be cast in close combat, in which case it causes 3D6 S 2 hits on a single enemy unit in base contact with the caster.

Name: Wither
Description: The target suffers -1 to their T for the remainder of the game. This can be cast multiple times on the same target and the effects are cumulative.

Name: Cloud of Corruption
Description: Affects all units within range. Roll a D6 for each unit (friend or foe), even if they are in close combat. Enemy units are affected on a 2+, friendly units are affected on a 4+, and models from Clan Pestilens (friend or foe) are affected on a roll of 5+. Each unit that is affected suffers D6 S 5 hits which Ignores Armour saves. Roll separately for each unit.

Name: Plague
Description: May be cast on enemies in close combat. Each model in the targeted unit must pass a T test or suffer one Wound which Ignores Armour saves. If cast on a unit engaged in close combat, all units involved in the fight (friend and foe) will be affected. After working out the effects of the spell and removing casualties, roll a dice on the Plague Chart and continue to apply the results until the spell ends or there are no targets within range.

Id: djaf's incantation of cursed blades/lore of nehekhara
Name: Djaf's Incantation of Cursed Blades
Description: The target unit's close combat Attacks gain Killing Blow until the start of your next Magic phase. If the target unit's Attacks already have Killing Blow or Heroic Killing Blow, these will take effect on any To Wound rolls of a 5 or 6 whilst this spell is in play. Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range.

Id: neru's incantation of protection/lore of nehekhara
Name: Neru's Incantation of Protection
Description: The target unit gains a Ward save (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range.

Id: ptra's incantation of righteous smiting/lore of nehekhara
Name: Ptra's Incantation of Righteous Smiting
Description: All models in the target unit gain +1 A (including mounts) and Multiple Shots (2) (excluding war machines) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, a. If they already have Multiple Shots, they may instead fire an additional shot. Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range.

Id: usirian's incantation of vengeance/lore of nehekhara
Name: Usirian's Incantation of Vengeance
Description: The target unit suffers -D3 to its Movement (to a minimum of 1) and treats all terrain (even open ground) as Dangerous Terrain, testing every time it moves (including when charging, fleeing, pursuing, moving compulsorily, etc.) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Name: The Restless Dead
Description: Each time a Wizard successfully casts an augment spell from the Lore of Nehekhara at a friendly, Undead unit, the target(s) of the spell immediately recovers D6+1 Wounds' worth of models, as described in Resurrecting Fallen Warriors. MI, MC, MB and Monsters can only ever recover a single lost Wound in this way per spell.

Id: khsar's incantation of the desert wind/lore of nehekhara 2
Name: Khsar's Incantation of the Desert Wind
Description: Targets a friendly Undead unit. If unengaged, the target can immediately make a normal move (but not march or reform) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase. Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range. No unit can be moved by Khsar's Incantation of the Desert Wind more than once per turn (though they still benefit from the Restless Dead Lore Attribute).

Id: usekhp's incantation of desiccation/lore of nehekhara loremaster
Name: Usekhp's Incantation of Desiccation
Description: The target unit has -1/D3 S and -1/D3 T (to a minimum of 1) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.

Id: sakhmet's incantation of the skullstorm/lore of nehekhara loremaster
Name: Sakhmet's Incantation of the Skullstorm
Description: Remains in play. Sakhmet's Incantation of the Skullstorm uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the player nominates the direction in which the Skullstorm will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply the result by the caster's Wizard level. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster instead; the template moves a number of inches equal to the caster's Wizard level, in a random direction (if you roll a hit, the template remains where it is). Any model under, or passed over by, the template suffers a single S 5 hit. In subsequent turns, the Skullstorm travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll of an artillery dice (if a misfire is rolled, the Skullstorm dissipates and is removed).

Id: the curse of undeath/lore of necromancy vc 1
Name: The Curse of Undeath
Description: When a spell from the Lore of Necromancy is successfully cast, one Undead unit within range of the caster regain 1 Wound following the rules for Invocation of Nehek.

Id: invocation of nehek/lore of necromancy vc 1
Name: Invocation of Nehek
Description: Targets all friendly Undead units within range. The target units immediately regain a number of Wounds as follows: infantry gain D6 plus the caster's Wizard level in Wounds (roll for each unit); other troop types targeted gain 1 plus the caster's Wizard level in Wounds. However, characters, Shrines, Chariots, Monsters or Ethereal models can never regain more than 1 Wound per successful casting.

Name: Vanhel's Danse Macabre
Description: That targets a friendly unengaged Undead unit within range. The target unit can immediately make a normal move (but not march or reform) as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase (including any Characters in the unit) Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range.

Name: Hellish Vigour
Description: Targets a friendly Undead unit within range. The unit gains Always Strikes First and may re-rolls failed To Hit rolls in Close Combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version targets all friendly Undead units within range.

Name: Gaze of Nagash
Description: Causes 2D6 S 4 hits.

Name: Raise Dead (ZP)
Description:
Brings a brand new unit of Zombie Pirate Deckhands into play. Choose a point on the battlefield â€“ that point need not lie in the caster's line of sight or forward arc. Next, roll 2D6+3. This is how many models comprise the new unit. Boosted version summons 2D6+3 Zombie Pirate Gunners instead.

When placing this unit, it must be wholly within the spell's range and at least 1" away from all units, buildings and impassable terrain. It can be placed facing any direction, and in any legal formation, as long as the unit's front rank contains at least five models. This unit does not have any upgrades or command models. Units summoned by this spell cannot be dispelled, and do not award victory points under any circumstances. Finally, if a summoned unit cannot be placed because there is not enough room, the unit does not enter play at all, though the spell's lore
attribute may still apply.

Name: Raise Dead (VC)
Description:
Brings a brand new unit of Zombies into play. Choose a point on the battlefield â€“ that point need not lie in the caster's line of sight or forward arc. Next, roll 2D6+3. This is how many models comprise the new unit. Boosted version summons 2D6+3 Skeleton Warriors instead.

When placing this unit, it must be wholly within the spell's range and at least 1" away from all units, buildings and impassable terrain. It can be placed facing any direction, and in any legal formation, as long as the unit's front rank contains at least five models. This unit does not have any upgrades or command models. Units summoned by this spell cannot be dispelled, and do not award victory points under any circumstances. Finally, if a summoned unit cannot be placed because there is not enough room, the unit does not enter play at all, though the spell's lore
attribute may still apply.

Name: Curse of Years
Description:
Remains in Play. When cast, roll a D6 for every model in the target unit - on a score of 6 the model suffers a Wound. At the end of the next Magic phase, roll again for each model in the unit, they will
suffer a Wound on a 5+, and so on, to a maximum of 2+. No armour saves are allowed against Wounds caused by Curse of Years.

Name: Wind of Death
Description: Remains in play. Uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates the direction in which the Wind of Death will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply the result by 3. Any model passed over by the template takes a S 3 hit which Ignores Armour Saves. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster and roll a scatter dice and a D6. The template moves a number of inches equal to the roll of the D6, in the direction indicated by the scatter dice. If a Hit! is rolled, use the small arrow on the Hit! symbol. In either event, in subsequent turns, the Wind of Death will move a number of inches determined by rolling an artillery dice, in a random direction determined by rolling a scatter dice. If a misfire is rolled in subsequent turns, the Wind of Death dissipates and is removed.

Name: Verdurous Harmony
Description: Whenever a spell from the Lore of Athel Loren is cast on a friendly unit, that unit immediately recovers 1 Wound (rounding up to 2) worth of models, as described for the Regrowth spell in the Lore of Life.

Name: Tree Singing
Description:
Targets a single forest within range of the caster. If there are no units within the forest, it immediately moves up to D6+1" in a direction of your choice. A forest cannot move to within 1" of units or other terrain features.

If there is at least one unit (friendly or enemy) within the forest, then the forest does not move. Instead, choose a single enemy unit at least partially within the forest; that unit immediately suffers 2D6 S 4 hits. Boosted version targets all forests within range.

Id: fury of the forest/lore of athel loren
Name: Fury of the Forest
Description: If successfully cast, the spell causes D6 S 4 hits. If the target is within 6" of a wood, then this is increased to 2D6 S 4 hits.

Id: the twilight host/lore of athel loren
Name: The Twilight Host
Description: Until the caster's next Magic phase, the unit causes Fear. If the unit would already cause fear, it instead causes Terror. In addition, the unit will counts as having twice the Unit Strength it really has for the purpose of determining Steadfast and Outnumber.

Id: the hidden path/lore of athel loren
Name: The Hidden Path
Description: The unit gains Ethereal until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If the unit becomes engaged in close combat, the spell instantly ends.

Id: madrigal of greening/lore of athel loren
Name: Madrigal of Greening
Description: Place a forest of your choosing no more than 12" in diameter within the spellâ€™s maximum range. Any models under this forest are placed within them (in exactly the same formation and facing).

Name: Ariel's Blessing
Description: The unit gains Regeneration (4+) until the start of the player's next Magic phase.

Id: the call of the hunt/lore of athel loren
Name: The Call of the Hunt
Description: Until the start of the casterâ€™s next Magic phase, the unit gains +1 A (does not affect steeds or ridden monsters). If the unit is not engaged in combat, it immediately moves forward towards the closest enemy unit using Random Movement (2D6).
